content.original:
The Dragon and later Grand Dragon have been a staple of Draconis Combine cavalry units since the early days of the Succession Wars. Attempts by LAW to modernize this emblematic BattleMech over the past century largely met with success and never strayed from the basic performance profile. LAW wisely chose to keep with tradition in this latest variant, while taking advantage of the influx of Clan-grade weaponry. In order to reduce costs, many components are shared with the newest Lancelot variant. The resulting DRG-12K is far and away the most deadly Grand Dragon to enter DCMS rolls Quirk: Stable Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.08

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

content.original: The Grand Dragon is the successful follow-up to the Dragon BattleMech. Just like the Dragon, the Grand Dragon quickly became a favorite in the DCMS, with nearly every line unit fielding a company of either design. Production of the Grand Dragon continued unabated until the Jihad, when the Word of Blake devastated LAW's factories in 3068. It took two years for LAW to get new Grand Dragon factories up and running, the first on Nykvarn followed by Abiy Adi and Savinsville, and ensure the continued use of the 'Mech in years to come.

content.original:
A refit fielded by the Wolf Empire and sold by the Sea Foxes, the Griffin C is a standardised refit package designed to bring captured Inner Sphere Griffins up to Clan spec. Swapping the standard 275 core for a 330-rated one significantly improves the ground speed and allows for the installation of 9 Improved Jump Jets; virtually doubling the mechs jump range. Swamping the standard PPC for a clan spec ER alternative and the LRM rack for a smaller Streak 10 allows the Griffin to strike at almost any range. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.11

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

content.original: The Clans upgraded and lightened the venerable Griffin design until the BattleMech now known as the Griffin IIC emerged. Seven tons of Ferro-Fibrous armor are mounted on an Endo Steel frame, giving the Griffin IIC almost maximum armor protection for its size. It is slightly faster than its antecedent, and it correspondingly mounts enough jump jets to leap up to 180 meters at a time.

content.original:
Founded in 3132, Jötunn BattleWorx's one purpose was the local development of reinforced chassis technology in a workable BattleMech. Flush with Bear-Krona thanks to Gray Monday appropriations, Jötunn took an old Grizzly and rebuilt it. The Bruin’s superior durability and similar armament had relegated the Grizzly to obsolescence decades earlier. Four years of testing saw endless permutations of weapons to find the ideal combatant. To allocate mass lost to the chassis, the sturdy old reactor was replaced with an XL model with no loss in resilience, proving the concept. Its arsenal remained largely the same, though a Plasma rifle replaced the Gauss rifle and targeting was improved for all weapons. The Grizzly that marched off Jötunn’s first production line in 3138 was highly compromised, but the lessons learned informed the development of a new generation of OmniMechs Quirk: Easy to Pilot Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.16

Arm Actuator Limit: Left Lower

content.original: The Grizzly is a BattleMech that was developed by Clan Ghost Bear scientists in the 30th century. Unfortunately, the design excels at no one thing, so it never carved a niche in the Clan's touman. Thirteen tons of armor are mounted on an Endo Steel frame. Jump jets are mounted so that the Grizzly can leap up to 120 meters at a time. Aside from the 'jack of all trades, master of none' moniker, the Grizzly is also poorly engineered. Slagged armor tends to get stuck in joints and weapons, while the actuators are difficult to repair in their own right.

content.original:
The GUN-3ERD was intended to be a renewed symbol of friendly relations between the Combine, Commonwealth, and Republic shortly before the Blackout. Instead, it became one of the first casualties of the Inner Sphere’s descent into anarchy. Using X-Pulse lasers and Clan ER Medium Lasers to update the earlier designs, but still keeping the Gauss Rifles. Quirk: Cowl Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

content.original: Jointly developed by the Federated Commonwealth and the Draconis Combine, the 85 ton Gunslinger entered production in 3053. Powered by a 255-rated XL Engine, the Gunslinger 1ERD is armed with a pair of Gauss Rifles. 4 Medium Lasers, a pair of Medium Pulse Lasers and a Small laser add additional firepower at close ranges. A Guardian ECM Suite and a Beagle Active Probe enhance the Mechs capabilities, while a pair of Jump Jets increase mobility.

The Gùn is a moderately fast light OmniMech which was designed by the Capellan Confederation as an Infantry Support 'Mech. Designed with 10 tons of pod space, the default configuration of the Gùn features a combination of anti-infantry and anti-vehicle energy weaponry. The 'Mech also features a Small Cockpit and an XL Gyro. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Short Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.92

content.original: Intended for close-in combat, the Hammerhead Prime has 15 tons of hardened armor to help resist damage. As a result, the 'Mech is not heavily armed, its arsenal only consists of a mix of medium and close range weapons. The main gun is a Large Pulse Laser, while an Extended Range Medium Laser and a Streak SRM-6 launcher allow the Mech to handle an opponent once the Hammerhead closes in to short range Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

content.original: Skirmisher
content.prevOriginal: Skirmisher
content.content: Стрелок

content.original: The Hammerhead is a medium-sized Clan BattleMech designed as a skirmisher by Clan Sea Fox. Designed to loosely resemble a hammerhead shark, the design is intended to be aggressive with its opponents, yet also built around the concept of never getting knocked off its feet. Despite its merely adequate weapons array, the Hammerhead has achieved great success as a shock trooper wading though enemy formations to brawl with opponents twice its size at close range.

content.original: The Harpagos is a Clan Hell's Horses' heavy BattleMech designed for long-range combat. Armed with two Gauss rifles, the Harpagos can deliver devastating pinpoint damage at extreme ranges. While lacking jump jets, it boasts a top speed of 64 km/h, enabling it to reposition and maintain distance from its enemies. Its armor is also thick enough to withstand enemy attacks, making it a formidable opponent on the battlefield. However, the Harpagos has a large profile and is relatively slow compared to other heavy BattleMechs. Pilots must use careful positioning and cover to ensure its survival, while making use of its Gauss rifles to strike at enemies from afar. Quirk: QuadVee Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.17

content.original: Commander, the Harpagos is a heavy BattleMech developed by Clan Hell's Horses. It's armed with two Gauss rifles, capable of dealing massive amounts of damage to its targets from long range. However, due to its lack of jump jets, it's not as mobile as some other BattleMechs. It has a top speed of 64 km/h, which is decent for its weight class. Its heavy armor and firepower make it a great choice for a front-line combat unit.

content.original:
The first OmniMech both designed and built by the Lyran Alliance. The inspiration for the Hauptmann is drawn from the Daishi OmniMech used by the Clans. Using information from captured Daishis and data gleaned from the construction of the Firestarter OmniMech, which was shared by the Draconis Combine, the end result is a powerful OmniMech capable of defending itself in most combat situations. The Hauptmann is built on a standard chassis and powered by a 285 fusion engine, adding to the 'Mech's durability as it cannot be killed by a side torso loss. The Hauptmann has eleven double heat sinks fixed on the chassis and can add more if needed in its various configurations. For protection, the Hauptmann carries eighteen and a half tons of armor and has CASE fixed in the right torso to protect against an ammunition explosion. Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.12

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

content.original: A 3050's era design, the Hecatoncheires is the FWL's attempt to produce a dedicated heavy scout suitable for the modern battlefield. Based on a previously rejected redesign of the venerable Cyclops, the Hecatoncheires downsizes the classic cyclops to 65 tons in weight. A Beagle Active probe paired with a C3 unit make up the mech's specialist electronics. 4 Medium Lasers and a pair of SRM-6s with Artemis IV provide a nasty punch at close range, while a Gauss Rifle covers longer ranges. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

content.original: A 3050's era design, the Hecatoncheires is the FWL's attempt to produce a dedicated heavy scout suitable for the modern battlefield. Based on a previously rejected redesign of the venerable Cyclops, the Hecatoncheires downsizes the classic cyclops to 65 tons in weight. A Beagle Active probe paired with a C3 unit make up the mech's specialist electronics.  4 Medium Lasers and a pair of SRM-6s with Artemis IV provide a nasty punch at close range, while a Gauss Rifle covers longer ranges.

content.original: Built to command BC3 equipped lances, the Hecatoncheires 6Cm is a minor upgrade to the 6C model. The Streak LRM-15 is downsized to a smaller SLRM-10, while dropping one ton of ammo. The remaining ton is moved to a new ammo bay located below the cockpit, a source of consternation for some pilots. With the freed weight and space, a Boosted C3 Master computer is mounted in the left torso. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

content.original:
A 65-ton design that emphasizes overwhelming firepower over speed or armor, the Hellbringer is a Clan OmniMech. Powered by a 325-rated XL Engine, the Hellbringer has 28.5 tons of pod space. The Hellbringer T is armed with a pair of ER PPC’s and an ATM-6. 3 ER Medium Lasers and a pair of AP Gauss Rifles cover close range combat. AMS protects the Hellbringer T from missiles while CASE II protects the munitions bay. Quirk: Integrated Searchlight Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

content.original:
The final Hellcat design blends the speed of the Conjurer 6 with the loadout of the Falcons' prototype. The new engine's notorious fragility is balanced by ample ferro-fibrous armor that has protected Conjurers for centuries. The blend of weapon types allows pilots to make sustained attacks before taxing the cooling system of the finicky XXL power plant. Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

content.original: What is now known as the Hellcat had its humble origins in a Clan's desperation nearly a century ago. One of the many projects born out of Clan Nova Cat's post-Abjurement rebuilding program was a radical take on the Conjurer BattleMech. Jade Falcon merchants took advantage of their old rival's panic, swapping sorely needed raw materials for access to the Cats' ballooning catalog of 'Mech chassis. Falcon technicians and scientists reworked an atypical Conjurer variant to emphasize flexible firepower over the Nova Cat model's speed and energy-based weaponry. Named as a subtle wink to both the BattleMech's creators and the Conjurer's Spheroid name, their early Hellcat saw only limited production before the Jihad.

content.original:
The Hellion is a product of Clan Ice Hellion and their philosophy that espouses speed above all else. Based on the Mist Lynx, the Hellion is a fast OmniMech that has respectable firepower. This light 'Mech is rather difficult to kill, incorporating five and a half tons of Ferro-Fibrous armor. To save weight, the Hellion also uses an Endo Steel chassis. While it is not especially fast for its size, the Hellion does use MASC to allow for bursts of additional speed. The Hellion sports no fixed weapons on its chassis. The T configuration consists of three Medium Pulse Lasers, a LRM-10 launcher and three Streak SRM 2 Improved One Shot launchers. Quirk: Nimble Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.98

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

content.original: A very formidable and mobile light unit, as most Clan designs tend to be. Enough armor so that a single alpha strike usually is not able to cripple it, and enough speed to get away from trouble, it can be as persisent as a cockroach at times. Oh, and it sports quite the bite too.

content.original:
The -7A increases prior models' firepower with innovative technologies. A light engine frees up mass to upgrade the base frame. The previously favored heavy PPC is swapped for an AC/10, which provides heavy firepower. Although this may seem a poor trade, the ammunition reliance forces the -7A not to overextend itself. CASE II provides some improved protection to the relatively weak armor, while the pulse laser is upgraded to an X-pulse version. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.02

Arm Actuator Limit: Left Lower

content.original: Scout
content.prevOriginal: Scout
content.content: Разведка

content.original: The Hermes II was first produced in 2798, based on the original Hermes BattleMech that had been used by the Star League. A heavy scout, the Hermes II boasted respectable weaponry, armoring, and speed, allowing it to easily brawl with lighter 'Mechs or survive an encounter with heavier 'Mechs and retreat. Out of all medium-weight 'Mechs at the time the Hermes II was the easiest to perform field maintenance on, leading to its nickname 'old reliable.' As combination scout and light strike platforms, Hermes II 'Mechs often operated alone, employed for missions for which lighter 'Mechs were too fragile and heavier 'Mechs too clumsy. The Hermes II was in its element when operating in a restrictive environment like a forest or city, where it could employ a most unusual tactic of setting its surroundings on fire to escape pursuit. Since most 'Mech pilots would naturally avoid a fire to prevent overheating and the flames interfered with most thermal scanners, starting a blaze allowed the Hermes II to more easily slip away.

content.original: A close-range fighter with the added role of anti-infantry striker, this configuration features a right arm mounted large pulse laser, a pair of AP Gauss rifles split between the arms, two ER medium lasers, and a flamer mounted in the left arm. To assist it in reaching its targets, eight improved jump jets are also fitted. Quirk: Distracting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

content.original: Striker
content.prevOriginal: Striker
content.content: Ударная единица

content.original: The Hierofalcon is a medium Clan OmniMech designed primarily as a striker unit by Clan Jade Falcon. As part of the push to be ever more flexible in movement, the 'Mech features a 270-rated extralight engine, allowing the mech to move at speeds up to 97.2 km/h. The addition of a permanently equipped partial wing adds dual benefits, both increasing jump distance and cooling capabilities. The 'Mech's hull is protected by seven and a half tons of ferro-fibrous armor, giving it modest protection from enemy fire, while an ECM suite provides additional protection from other threats.

content.original: A missile-oriented configuration, The B's main payload consists of six SRM-6 launcher. Each side torso mounts a pair of the launchers, while one additional launcher can be found in each arm. Two ammo bins of 30 missiles are mounted in each of the side torsos with CASE II, ensuring lucky hits do not take out the 'Mech. These missile armaments are backed up by arm-mounted ER small lasers and an ER medium laser in the center torso. Quirk: Distracting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

content.original: The D configuration lacks jump jets, unlike earlier configurations, but features a supercharger to make up for this. This configuration is mostly a laser-based striker model, with a pair of ER medium lasers and medium pulse lasers in each of its arms. For added all-range firepower, it features two ATM-6 launchers in each of its side torsos, with the ammunition protected by CASE II. Quirk: Distracting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

For added all-range firepower, it features two ATM-6 launchers in each of its side torsos, with the ammunition protected by CASE II. Особенность: Отвлекающий Множитель стоимости высадки: 1.04

content.original: Striker
content.prevOriginal: Striker
content.content: Ударная единица

content.original: The Hierofalcon is a medium Clan OmniMech designed primarily as a striker unit by Clan Jade Falcon. As part of the push to be ever more flexible in movement, the 'Mech features a 270-rated extralight engine, allowing the mech to move at speeds up to 97.2 km/h. The addition of a permanently equipped partial wing adds dual benefits, both increasing jump distance and cooling capabilities. The 'Mech's hull is protected by seven and a half tons of ferro-fibrous armor, giving it modest protection from enemy fire, while an ECM suite provides additional protection from other threats.

content.original: Its Primary configuration features a HAG/20 in the right arm with two tons of ammunition allotted to the weapon. This is backed up by a pair of improved heavy medium lasers mounted in the left arm. Intended as a spotter, the Hierofalcon features a TAG. The fixed partial wing enhances the jump range of the six improved jump jets, allowing for leaps of up to 240 meters, and additionally enhances the cooling capabilities of the 10 double heat sinks. Quirk: Distracting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

content.original:
When Clan Hell's Horses occupied the site of the W-7 Facilities in 3142, Clan Wolf had not taken everything. The boneyard where Highlanders had been refit to IIC-standard for seventy years was extensive. With the Inner Sphere desperately rearming, spare Highlanders viable for upgrading were a rare commodity, so the Horses improved the line to build the SL-XT chassis while sourcing parts from New Oslo to Alnabog, the latter to our profit. While not quite the same as the ancient Clan 'Mech, the new Highlander IIC 4 proved a formidable package when unleashed in Operation Noyan. Quirk: Reinforced Legs Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.2

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

content.prevOriginal: Clan Battlemech
content.content: Боевой мех Кланов

content.original: One of the most popular Star League BattleMechs, many a Highlander accompanied General Aleksandr Kerensky into exile. Some were mothballed, but many found their way into the toumans of the Clans. As technology advanced, the weapons systems were upgraded until the design known as the Highlander IIC finally emerged. Though no new Highlanders have been produced in over a century, several hundred are still in scattered use throughout the touman of every Clan.

content.original: Built by Luthien Armor Works of New Samarkand, the Hitotsume Kozo is a medium BattleMech designed to serve in the Draconis Combine Mustered Soldiery. This 'Mech's creation was partially influenced by an unofficial cultural rebirth. Keeping this in mind, LAW styled the appearance of the Hitotsume Kozo after the ancient Japanese Bushido armor worn by the samurai warriors during that time period on Terra. It received a poor reception by front-line troops due its advanced features and high heat output; however, it was appreciated when transferred to less-favored combat units, such as Ghost Regiments, as these less-fickle warriors adapted to the design's quirks and turned it into an effective combat unit. Quirk: Stable Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

content.original:
The encroachment of Clan Jade Falcon has inspired ever more desperate responses from the defenders of Arc-Royal. The Hoplite had been used as a test-bed in prior decades, yielding formidable builds, but their exotic materials cut production to a trickle even before the Falcon war. Redesigned to make use of local materials, the HOP-5C offers a cheap trooper 'Mech for inexperienced warriors. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

content.original: Fire Support
content.prevOriginal: Fire Support
content.content: Огневая поддержка

content.original: Conceived by Martinson Armaments of Terra in 2578 as an infantry support 'Mech, the Hoplite first saw service with the newly formed Star League Defense Force during the Reunification War before being relegated to Terran Hegemony militia units in the twenty-seventh century. Intended for infantry support, the Hoplite is slow for a medium 'Mech with a top speed of only 64.8 km/h. However its eleven and a half tons of armor and heavy arsenal, both impressive for a 'Mech of its size, makes the Hoplite a rugged machine able to fight its way out of most situations using superior firepower. The original Reunification War era model, save for using an older Dalban Sniper targeting and tracking system, was all but identical to the 4C.

content.original: The Horned Owl, or Peregrine as the Inner Sphere designated it, is a light, fast second-line BattleMech capable of highly accurate fire. It was designed by Clan Goliath Scorpion as a rugged submersible construction ’Mech and was later rebuilt for combat[1]. A harassing platform, the Horned Owl is also a capable dueling 'Mech. Five tons of ferro-fibrous armor provide adequate protection for the light 'Mech.

content.original: Also known as the Shimafukuro, this variant reduces the top speed to 86 km/h and uses a partial wing to jump 210 meters at a time. A light TAG system is mounted in the head, and each arm carries a medium pulse laser, but the main firepower comes from an ER large laser. All the weapons are tied into a targeting computer. Quirk: Stable Weapons Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.06

content.original:
A Nova Cat design, the 50 ton Huntsman was designed for Operation Revival and the invasion of the Inner Sphere; first entering production in 3049. An OmniMech, the Huntsman is built around a 250-rated XL Engine with an Endo Steel Skeleton and Ferro-Fibrous armor giving the OmniMech, 21.5 tons of pod space. 5 Jump Jets are fixed to the chassis, giving the Huntsman additional flexibility. The Huntsman F is armed with an Improved Heavy Large Laser and a pair of Artemis V enhanced LRM-15’s. A pair of ER Medium Lasers provide additional firepower at close range. A Targeting Computer enhances the weapons accuracy. Quirk: Stable Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

content.original:
First produced in 2948, the Ice Ferret is a medium scout OmniMech often employed as a head hunter or strike unit. A 45 ton Clan OmniMech, the Ice Ferret is powered by a 360-rated XL Engine and has 9.5 tons of pod space thanks to a combination of Endo Steel, an XL Engine and Ferro-Fibrous. The Ice Ferret IFR-K is armed with a Large Pulse Laser, an ER Small Laser and a pair of ER Medium Lasers. Laser AMS improves the Ice Ferrets defensive capabilities. Quirk: Improved Sensors Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

content.original: Omni Brawler
content.prevOriginal: Omni Brawler
content.content: Омни-борец

content.original: The Inferno heavy OmniMech was introduced by StarCorps Industries of Crofton after New Avalon fell to the Draconis Combine Mustered Soldiery in the Dark Age. With twenty-nine tons of pod space available and protected by thirteen and a half tons of armor, the Inferno became a popular unit in the AFFS. By building on an Endo-Steel chassis with a Compact Gyro engineers were able to free up a lot of space in the traditionally crowded center torso. This freed room for heavy weapons in the most heavily protected part of the 'Mech. In every configuration the main weapons are mounted in the center torso, with additional weaponry in the side torsos (often in over the shoulder mounts), leaving the arms free for physical attacks.

A fire support configuration, an ER Medium Laser is in each torso. Like the primary configuration, an MML-5 is carried in the side torsos. For the main firepower, a Thunderbolt 15 missile launcher is mounted in the center torso. The right torso carries two tons of Thunderbolt ammo and two tons of MML ammunition in a CASE II protected bay. Similarly, CASE II protects a ton of MML ammunition and two more tons of Thunderbolt ammo in the left torso. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.06

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

content.original: The Ion Sparrow, initially designated as the Butcherbird when first encountered by the Lyran Intelligence Corps, was introduced by Clan Jade Falcon on Alyina as an experimental testbed for the advanced partial wing system. The Ion Sparrow uses an endo steel chassis, XL engine, ferro-fibrous armor, and small cockpit to save weight. Eight jump jets have been mounted in the right and left torso, and when paired with the partial wing, allows the Ion Sparrow to cover 300 meters per jump. The wing also works with the double heat sinks to dissipate more heat.

content.original: Relatively lightly armed for a heavy BattleMech, the Jade Hawk is equipped only with four Series 1g ER Small Lasers and a set of four Mk. 22 Type III SRM-6s, as well as the claws on its extremities, themselves impressive close combat weapons for Death from Above attacks and grappling with other 'Mechs in close combat conditions. This combination of melee and short ranged weaponry, heavy armor, and speed (rivaling 'Mechs a third of its tonnage) make the Jade Hawk a powerful close-in fighter and a force to be reckoned with in urban environments. Quirk: Distracting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

content.original: DOA's support model, JHK-04 drops the jump jets, partial wing, advanced myomers and supercharger in exchange for a pair of torso-mounted Streak LRM-15 launchers imported from the Sea Foxes. Three tons of reloads allow the pilot a decent combat radius, while the addition of IS-spec Heavy Duty Gyro and switch to Ferro-Fibrous armor offers a modest boost in protection. Quirk: Distracting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.17

content.original: Clan Jade Falcon's version of the Jade Hawk is purely Clan-spec and lacks the advanced myomers and claws of the DOA JHK-03 model, carrying four Streak SRM-6 launchers instead of the standard models and mounting a Light Active Probe in its head. Four tons of ammo give the design excellent endurance despite the large number of launchers, while the addition of Ferro-Fibrous plating increases its protection. Quirk: Distracting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

Особенность: Отвлекающий Множитель стоимости высадки: 1.15

content.original: The second Clan Jade Falcon model trades mobility for raw firepower, removing the jump-jets, wing and supercharger to upgrade two of its arm-mounted lasers to ER Large Lasers and its four SRM launchers to ATM-6s, mounting an additional ER Small Laser as well. Carrying four tons of reloads, generally two tons of standard ATM missiles and one each of Extended Range and High Explosive give it reasonable field endurance. Quirk: Distracting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.17

content.original:
The Jade Phoenix combines a 340-rated XL engine with Endo-Composite structure and Ferro-Fibrous armor to free enough weight capacity to be able to fits its four jump jets and partial wing system while still keep enough free for good weapons. The C configuration mounts the classical Jade Phoenix Talons on its legs. Combined with two ATM 12 launchers, two SRM-6 launchers and two ER Medium Lasers it can handle most situations and do plenty of damage both at range and close quarters engagements. Quirk: Distracting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.16

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

content.prevOriginal: Clan OmniMech
content.content: Омнимех Кланов

content.original: The newest generation of Falcon OmniMechs represents a rift in design philosophy that mirrors the rift inside the Clan. The savage adherents of Malvina Hazen pilot more stylized ’Mechs like the Gyrfalcon and Shrike, whereas more moderate warriors prefer the toned-down aesthetics of newer machines like the Jade Phoenix, just as they prefer a toned down version of combat. The Jade Phoenix embodies what it means to be a true Jade Falcon, as did its namesake, the legendary Aidan Pryde.

content.original:
The D loadout as usual for the Jade Falcon line of Mechs mounts no Jump Jets, even though the chassis has Partial Wings permanently attached. Instead it combines two ER PPC and a Gauss Rifle as the main weapons, with a single ER Medium Laser for close range support. All the weapons are bound together through a state of the art Tergeting Computer. Quirk: Distracting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.16

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

content.original:
The -DD is the latest variant of the 70 ton JM7 line of the JagerMech. An XL gyro and Endo-Composite skeleton let Kallon Weapon Industries apply modern upgrades. The JagerMech’s signature twin autocannons are now Clan-spec Ultra autocannons, supplemented by light autocannons. CASE II envelops its enlarged ammo bays, a dual comfort to pilots. Federated Suns MechWarriors of course love autocannons, and they have welcomed the new JM7-DD with open arms. Quirk: Anti-Air Targeting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

content.original: Fire Support
content.prevOriginal: Fire Support
content.content: Огневая поддержка

content.original: The JagerMech was designed as an anti-aircraft platform and long-range fire support unit intended to correct several perceived faults of the original Rifleman. After the FedCom Civil War further development of the JagerMech split along three different lines. The first were simple field refits of the original JM6-DD, such as the H and DG models. The second was a complete overhaul as part of Victor Steiner-Davion's 'Redesign for Davion Pride' program, resulting in the JagerMech III. The third was the creation of a divergent line, the JM7 series, built on a slightly heavier chassis massing 70 instead of 65 tons that was nevertheless not considered enough of a change to change the chassis name.

content.original:
The G9B is an updated variant for the Dark Ages, fielded by the Capellan Confederation. Replacing the Gauss rifle for a Clan ER PPC was a deliberate choice to alleviate the Jinggau's ammunition dependency while maintaining damage output and eliminating the risk of internal explosions. The armor was increased to align it with other modern CCAF cavalry designs such as the Mortis and Vandal, and the medium pulse laser was upgraded to an X-Pulse model. However, the most significant changes were buried deep within: triple-strength myomer lets the 'Mech increase its mobility when it runs hot, and a supercharger provides additional speed boosts so it can quickly close with the enemy. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

content.original:
Designed in secret by a renegade faction within ComStar is the Kheper is a front line Medium Class BattleMech design intended to be a staple a unit within the secretly resurrected 1st Division of the Com Guard. In the aftermath of the Com Guards' destruction, the Kheper's simple construction and ease of maintenance qualities met with the needs of rebuilding the RAF. After the conflict, the New Earth-based manufacturing center would be seized by Republican forces and the production output would pour into the ranks of the Republic of the Sphere. Quirk: Advanced Optics Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

content.original: A Dark Age redesign of the King Crab, the KGC-011 is an unusual take on the classic assault mech. A 400-rated XXL Engine and a Supercharger make the KGC-011 the fastest King Crab to ever walk off of Cosara’s production line. A pair of LB-20X’s and a Plasma Rifle provide a devastating close range punch, whilst a Rocket Launcher acts as a backup weapon should an enemy survive to close in. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18

A 400-rated XXL Engine and a Supercharger make the KGC-011 the fastest King Crab to ever walk off of Cosara’s production line. A pair of LB-20X’s and a Plasma Rifle provide a devastating close range punch, whilst a Rocket Launcher acts as a backup weapon should an enemy survive to close in.

content.original:

It mounts an LB 20-X Autocannon pod, three Improved Heavy Medium Laser pods, a SRM-6 pod and a Supercharger to make it possible to arrive close enough to use the weaponry. A single ER Small Laser pod is used for anti-infantry needs. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.17

A Light Clan OmniMech, the 30 ton Kit Fox was introduced in 2890 by Clan Cloud Cobra. Favouring a mix of firepower and armor over speed, the Kit Fox is powered by a 180 XL Engine and features a mix of Endo Steel and Ferro-Fibrous; giving it 16 tons of pod space. The Kit Fox BLO is armed with a UAC/10, an ER Medium Laser and an ER Small Laser. C3i rounds out the variant. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99

content.original: The second variant of the Kodiak II is known for its resilience as well as its accurate weaponry. Introduced in the early 32nd Century, the Kodiak II 2 utilizes a number of advanced technologies which includes three torso mounted HarJel III Self-Repair Systems. Aside from inclusion of the new repair system, the version of the Kodiak II differs only slightly from the original. While retaining most of 'Mech weaponry and the Targeting Computer, the 'Mech's long-range weaponry are swapped out for pair of Streak LRM-20 launchers, while the 10-tubed launcher is dropped. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.24

content.original: The Kodiak II was built upon what Clan Ghost Bear learned and liked with the original Kodiak. The Kodiak II quickly became known for its Command facilities and its endurance. The powerful 'Mech carries 19 tons of Standard armor, giving it heavy resistance against weapons fire directed at it. At the heart of the machine is a 400-rated Extra-Light Fusion Engine, which while not as quick as other designs its weight saving qualities allows the 'Mech to carry is substantial weapons load out.

content.original: The Kontio is a clawed melee monstrosity, able to charge foes at a staggering 172 km/h with both the TSM and Supercharger activated. The fact that the 'Mech is also shrouded in cutting edge Stealth armor, making it even harder to detected before it strikes its target has given the Kontio a reputation of being a pilot killer. It offers a poor death on the end of its claws. Enemy pilots either avoid Kontios or target them, for fear of a messy end. Quirk: Distracting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.08

content.original:
With the redesign of the Lancelot to share common parts with the Grand Dragon the mech had a comeback. ClanTech ER and pulse lasers provide the -09’s primary and secondary weapons, supported with a deadly plasma rifle. Much-strengthened armor improves its endurance. It is often paired with newer Grand Dragons, providing fire support as the Dragons close in. Quirk: Anti-Air Targeting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.08

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

content.original:
Designed as a replacement to the Timber Wolf, the 65 ton Linebacker entered production in 3052. Built around a 390-rated XL Engine, the Linebacker’s faster speed enables it to keep up with lighter star mates in running battles, something the Timber Wolf struggled to do. A combination of Ferro-Fibrous armor and Endo Steel give the OmniMech 17.5 tons of free pod space. The Linebacker LBK-I is armed with an ER Large Laser and 4 Machine Gun Arrays. Quirk: Stable Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

content.original:
In an attempt to use the popularity of the Longbow platform as a missile boat to move it into more of a closer combat profile, the -10K was created. However, this was not meet with any larger success despite using both CASE and increasing the protection to include 16 tons of armor, as there are other 'Mechs in the same weight range that were seen as performing the role better. The -10K mounted two Ultra AC/20s combined with an ER Large Laser and a Medium Pulse laser. Six tons of autocannon ammunition was carried, but only four tons of them under CASE protection - a choice that generated quite a bit of critique. Another point of contention was the XL engine used, as this was seen as making the 'Mech more prone to engine problems and reducing its reliability. Quirk: Anti-Air Targeting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

content.original: The Longbow, introduced in 2480, has seen service in the armies of the Inner Sphere since the days of the Star League and is one of the most well-known fire support 'Mechs in existence. As a fire-support 'Mech though, the Longbow is a trusted and reliable machine that can be counted on to carry out the mission it is designed for. The primary weapons on the Longbow are its LRM launchers, four in all, a pair of 20s and a pair of 5s, letting the Longbow put out 50 LRMs into any target it can see.

content.original:
With the success of the Mad Cat Mk II design Clan Diamond Shark developed the Mad Cat III as a medium 'Mech to accompany the heavy Mad Cat and assault Mad Cat II. Intended for sale to both Inner Sphere and Clan customers, it has been shunned by the Clans save for the Nova Cats and Exiled Wolves as '...an outrage against everything Nicholas Kerensky stood for and taught us.' However, it has proven popular with the Successor States. Quirk: Improved Communications Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

Powered by a 360-rated XL Engine, the Mad Cat Mk II 7 is armed with a pair of HAG/20’s and a pair of Streak LRM-10’s. A pair of ER Medium Lasers act as backup weapons. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Medium Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.22

This variant uses six Improved Jump Jets to cover 180 meters at a time. The weapons have changed: Each arm carries a Large Pulse Laser over a Medium Pulse Laser. There is an ER PPC in the left torso, and a pair of ER Small Lasers in the center torso. A Small Pulse Laser is mounted in each side torso for anti-infantry work. Twenty double heat sinks are fitted, and the 'Mech is protected by thirteen tons of armor. Quirk: Hyper-Extending Actuators Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.19

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

This variant uses six Improved Jump Jets to cover 180 meters at a time. The weapons have changed: Each arm carries a Large Pulse Laser over a Medium Pulse Laser. There is an ER PPC in the left torso, and a pair of ER Small Lasers in the center torso. A Small Pulse Laser is mounted in each side torso for anti-infantry work. Twenty double heat sinks are fitted, and the 'Mech is protected by thirteen tons of armor. Особенность: Гиперрасширяющиеся приводы Множитель стоимости высадки: 1.19

content.original: Touted as one of the most effective 'Mechs of all time, the Marauder saw wide usage by the SLDF before and during their Exodus from the Inner Sphere. During the years before their return, the Clans developed a followup to the venerable design, later dubbed the Marauder IIC, representing the pinnacle of Clan weapons technology prior to the advent of the OmniMech. Like other IIC designs, visual similarities between it and its predecessor initially led ComStar to incorrectly label the design as a mere refit of the original.

content.original:
Appearing in 3012, the Marauder II is a redesign of the classic Marauder, turning the 75 ton Heavy Mech into a 100 ton Assault. Originally a Wolf's Dragoons exclusive Mech, it wasn’t until after the 4th War of Succession in 3030 that the Mech would spread beyond the Dragoons. Powered by a 400-rated XL Engine, the Marauder II MAD-10D is armed with a Large Re-Engineered Laser, paired Can ER PPC’s and Medium X-Pulses. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18

content.original:
A Dark Age rebuild of the Mauler, the Mauler 4K is a Kuritan update of the older 3R variant. Designed as a heavy brawler and urban assault unit, the Mauler 4K swaps the LRM-20’s of the 3K for Apollo enhanced MRM-30’s and the LB-10X’s for Snub Nose PPC’s. The XL Engine is removed to lower costs and increase durability, though this has resulted in the loss of 3 tons of armor which is seen as an acceptable trade-off. The C3 Slave is retained, allowing the 4K to transmit data which it’s longer range lance mates can take advantage of. 16 DHS keep the 4K cool while 4 tons of MRM ammo in CASE protected bays give the MRM’s plenty to shoot with. Quirk: Distracting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.16

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

content.original:
Named for the door guards who serve to ward off evil spirits from a home, the Men Shen is the first OmniMech to come from the Capellan Confederation, it borrows heavily from the Raven BattleMech for its basic design concept. The 'Mech is built on a lightweight Endo Steel chassis and is powered by a vulnerable but light VOX 330 XL Engine that gives it a top speed of 97.2 km/h that is augmented by MASC system allowing the 'Mech to be pushed up to 129.6 km/h in short bursts. The Men Shen comes with eleven tons of armor, giving it a respectable amount of protection. The Men Shen carries on its base chassis a Beagle Active Probe allowing it to serve in a recon role regardless of its configuration. For weapons and equipment the Men Shen has seventeen tons of free pod space. Quirk: Improved Communications Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.95

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

content.original:
Reintroduced in 3148, the Minsk 2 is an updated copy of the Golden Age Minsk MNK-1. Developed for second line units in the Rasalhague Dominion, the Minsk 2 is a 70-ton Mech. Powered by a 210-rated Fusion Core, the MSK-2 is armed with a pair of Capacitor enhanced ER PPCs and a Mech Mortar/6. Paired Streak SRM-6s, Small Pulse Lasers and B-Pods add additional firepower at close range. An Active Probe allows the Minsk to spot hidden opponents while an Angel ECM shields the Mech from enemy sensors. Quirk: Protected Actuators Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.16

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

content.original:
A common Light OmniMech, the Mist Lynx is fielded by every Clan since its introduction in 2926. A 25-ton mech, the Mist Lynx is powered by a 175-rated XL Engine and is built with a combination of Endo Steel and Ferro-Fibrous that gives it a respectable 7.5 tons of pod space. An Active Probe is hardwired into the chassis boosting the Mist Lynx’s effectiveness as a scout. The Mist Lynx M is armed with a Plasma Cannon, an SRM-2 and 4 ER Micro Lasers. Quirk: Improved Sensors Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

content.original: The Naga II is a further continuation from Clan Wolf's first OmniMech, the Woodsman. What originally was a technical failure during the first batches of production of the Woodsman got converted into the Naga, later refined into the Naga II, but still suffering from bad reputation as a partial failure. The Naga II keeps much of of the core design the same as the original Naga; an Endo Steel internal structure, 9 tons of standard armor and a 400 XL engine.

content.original:
The general unpopularity of the Nexus, along with its link to the Word of Blake, drove it to the brink of extinction. It therefore came as a shock when a new variant, flagged as the NXS1-C, appeared in the reborn Com Guard during Malcolm Buhl's last stand on Epsilon Eridani. The -C proved more versatile than its predecessors. It was pressed into striker and anti-infantry support roles, and it proved deadly to the combined-arms formations of the Republic assault force. Quirk: Nimble Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.98

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

content.original: The BattleMech known as the Nexus was originally based on the Jackrabbit, a light scout and combat vehicle and infantry support 'Mech built for the Star League Defense Force by Skobel MechWorks. Ironically, the Jackrabbit ended testing two weeks before Stefan Amaris seized power on Terra and was instead primarily used by units loyal to Amaris against the SLDF in General Kerensky's drive to liberate the Terran Hegemony. Though the SLDF captured Skobel's plant relatively intact, thanks to the stigma of being used against his forces Kerensky ordered it shutdown and the unloved Jackrabbit disappeared into history outside of ComStar's records. With the Com Guards looking to recoup their grievous losses in the wake of the Battle of Tukayyid, in 3054 Precentor Martial Anastasius Focht ordered the Skobel plant reactivated, reworking the slower Jackrabbit into a fast and highly mobile recon striker 'Mech he renamed the Nexus.

content.original: Designed during the Amaris Civil War as a command Mech, the 95 ton Nightstar would not see production until the chaos of the First Succession War. The Nightstar ceased production a year after it first walked off the factory line and would not see production again until the late 3050’s. Powered by a 285-rated XL Engine, the Nightstar 10D is armed with a pair of Light Gauss Rifles and a pair of Clan ER Large Lasers. A Medium X-Pulse Laser provides extra firepower at close quarters. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.17

This blistering firepower can often take down an opponent before they are in range. Three Medium Pulse Lasers serve as accurate backups. Eight additional double heat sinks keep the 'Mech fairly cool.

content.original: Long regarded as a pocket Assault OmniMech, the Nova Cat sacrifices speed for firepower. With over half of its tonnage dedicated to weapons, ammunition, and equipment, the Nova Cat packs a punch in all configurations. Some recent configurations increased the speed and agility that Clan customers typically desire.

content.original:
The T loadout combines three Large Pulse Lasers with two ER PPC. Attempting to address the main drawback of the base design, the loadout also adds a Supercharger for more burst of speeds. A total of 18 double heat sinks try to keep the 'Mech cool enough to not shutdown, but due to the full energy loadout the cooling is still so insufficient that an inexperienced MechWarrior can easily over do it with a few full Alpha Strikes. Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.11

content.original: The Orion K was the first true heavy 'Mech. As a multirole brawler, the Orion can engage enemies at a variety of ranges, and with plenty of armor, it can survive combined fire for quite some time. Slow, yes, but powerful.

content.original:
The Orion has long held an important place in the Clan Wolf Touman, and the Orion C 2 is a capable heir to the favored ride of Aleksandr Kerensky. The response has been mixed, however, as it continues to use non-Clan structural components to reduce the strain on the Wolves’ industrial resources. The weapons, though, are mostly Clan. Short to medium range is covered by a Streak rack and ER medium laser, backed up with a large pulse laser in the left arm. The Orion’s standard right torso ballistic weapon was replaced by an ER large laser, both for weight and range. Having been burned by the superior range of extended LRMs, the Wolves are experimenting with the weapon system on the C 2. Quirk: Anti-Air Targeting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

content.original: The Ostroc carries as its primary weapons two Fuersturm-C Large Lasers in the left and right torsos. These give the Ostroc good medium to long range damage capabilities. The Ostrocs secondary weapons are two Fuersturm-b Medium Lasers also mounted in the side torsos and a Totschlagen SRM-4 launcher in the right torso for close-range combat, with one ton of reloads carried in the center torso. While the Ostroc's laser-heavy weapons payload allows it to operate well as a guerrilla fighter since it has limited dependency on supply lines, its short arms are a handicap in close combat, and the shocks of hand-to-hand fighting can easily damage the Fuersturm systems.

content.original: The Ostscout was designed as a pure recon BattleMech by Ostmann Industries. To that end, it was built entirely around gathering data and getting out of trouble, tasks for which it is exceptional; the Ostscout is quick enough to escape most traps, and very few other designs can match it in terms of speed and maneuverability. The OST-12R is a stealth version of the Ostscout, combining a clan ER Large Laser with a Guardian ECM suite, Stealth Armor, a Light fusion engine and the classic 8 side-torso Jump Jets. To free the needed weight the OTT-12R further uses Endo-Composite internal structure. Quirk: Improved Sensors Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

content.original: The Ostscout was designed as a pure recon BattleMech by Ostmann Industries. To that end, it was built entirely around gathering data and getting out of trouble, tasks for which it is exceptional; the Ostscout is quick enough to escape most traps, and very few other designs can match it in terms of speed and maneuverability. The Ostscout 8J is highly prized by the Draconis Combine, using the classic 7J model as a base, it uses a GM 280-rated XL engine to free up weight to upgrade its electronics suite to modern standards, being fitted with an Angel ECM suite and Bloodhound active probe. Offensively the Medium Laser is swapped for a Martell-X medium X-Pulse laser supported by double heat sinks and six tons of ferro-fibrous armor. Quirk: Improved Sensors Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

content.original: Developed by Robinson Standard BattleWorks shortly before it was taken by the DCMS, this Ostsol carries a Large X-Pulse Laser and Medium X-Pulse Laser in each side torso. A pair of ER Small Lasers mounted in the center torso cover the rear arc. It is protected by eleven tons of ferro-fibrous armor, and an XL engine keeps it moving at 86 km/h. To make room for this equipment and seventeen double heat sinks, engineers had to fit a Compact Gyro. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.08

content.original: The Ostsol was designed as an all-energy-weapon alternative to Ostmann Industries' previous heavy BattleMechs, the Ostwar and the Ostroc. Armed with a mix of lasers and requiring little resupply, the Ostsol is nearly impossible to interdict and is able to operate independently of supply lines for extended periods of time. A versatile 'Mech, the Ostsol can operate as part of heavy lances in order to provide close-range firepower or lead recon and raiding lances thanks to its high speed and advanced electronics.

content.original: Developed by Clan Sea Fox, this Ostsol carries fifteen double heat sinks. It uses a 300-rated engine to move at a top speed of 86 km/h. The side torso weapons are an ER Large Laser and an Improved Heavy medium laser. Two ER medium lasers are mounted in the center torso and cover the rear. All these weapons are tied into an advanced Targeting Computer. For protection, the Ostsol C carries nine tons of Reflective Armor. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

content.original: This Wolf Empire variant is a much more thorough melding of Inner Sphere and Clan technologies. Built around a few central Inner Sphere-grade components - a 270-rated XL engine, seven standard jump jets, and an endo steel frame - while clad in five and a half tons of Clan-grade ferro-fibrous armor. Now better armored than the original and capable of a remarkable 151 km/h top speed, the Pack Hunter 5's sole weapon is the Clan-tech ER PPC that gave the original model its bite. Though this means the 5 is still plagued by the original's inability to engage multiple opponents, the sheer speed gained in this upgrade makes it ever easier to avoid most return fire. Quirk: Reinforced Legs Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

content.original: The Pack Hunter is the first new design produced by Clan Wolf-in-Exile on Arc-Royal. It also represents a new partnership between Phelan's Wolves and the Kell Hounds, as the armor and communications gear are Kell Hound products, traded to the Wolves in exchange for Endo Steel. Reflecting their Khan's bias towards light, fast designs, Wolf scientists designed the Pack Hunter to be fast and have a sharp bite. Though its four tons of armor are light, the BattleMech is supposed to use its speed and maneuverability to stay out of trouble.

content.original:
Kallon's latest Penetrator is an iterative development. Because of the increasing proliferation of reflective armor, older Penetrators struggled to deliver effective firepower. Kallon’s Tonkya complex on Wernke found an easy solution by leveraging the Federated Suns' experience with re-engineered lasers, mounting two Large ones as the main armament. Six Medium Lasers are kept as secondary, short range firepower, and a Laser AMS provides some defensive capabilities. Quirk: Stable Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.11

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

content.original: Few BattleMechs designed and produced in the Inner Sphere after the fall of the first Star League managed to become as beloved as the Penetrator. A mainstay of AFFS, LCAF, and mercenary heavy lances, it has a well-deserved reputation for phenomenal staying power. The variant was initially created by refitting battle-damaged Penetrators, but soon multiple production lines were dedicated to building this new variant. For the AFFS, struggling to recover from devastating losses of personnel and materiel, the PTR-8D has been a lifeline, and demand is sky-high.

content.original: Debuting by Clan Wolf in 3052, the Phantom is a 40 ton Clan Omnimech designed as scout and light mech hunter. A combination of an Endo Steel chassis and a 360-rated XL Engine allow the Phantom to achieve speeds of 151 km/h and maintain 6.5 tons of pod space. The Phantom Prime is armed with an ER Medium Laser and an ER Small Laser. A TAG unit, Active Probe and ECM suite allow it to act as a scout, while an LRM-5 gives it some ranged capabilities.

content.original:
The J configuration is the only loadout of the Phantom to mount a Supercharger. This increased boost in movement speed, combined with the three ER Medium Lasers and single Improved Heavy Medium Laser means the 'Mech can strafe enemies repeatedly without much risk if piloted by an experienced MechWarrior. Quirk: Improved Sensors Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.03

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

content.original: Debuting by Clan Wolf in 3052, the Phantom is a 40 ton Clan Omnimech designed as scout and light mech hunter. A combination of an Endo Steel chassis and a 360-rated XL Engine allow the Phantom to achieve speeds of 151 km/h and maintain 6.5 tons of pod space. The Phantom Prime is armed with an ER Medium Laser and an ER Small Laser. A TAG unit, Active Probe and ECM suite allow it to act as a scout, while an LRM-5 gives it some ranged capabilities.

content.original: For the longest time it seemed the first iteration of the Pillager was consigned to history. The idea of a jumping close-assault 'Mech with twin autocannons, however, was too good not to revisit, albeit half a millennium later. Used as a bodyguard of Gauss-equipped variants, the new 6Z variant features two massive Clan LB 20-X autocannons with a deadly punch at close to medium distances. The ER large laser offers only token long-range firepower, and this pitiful, lone back-up weapon can be the downfall of inexperienced pilots. The strategios issued an order to keep the new Pillager near support 'Mechs in open terrain, but MechWarriors eager to take the fight to the enemy often choose to ignore it. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18

content.original: The largest BattleMech ever built by HildCo Interplanetary, the Pillager is built as a larger version of the Victor, and is intended for assaulting urban centers and hardened fortifications. These design parameters were paramount as the SLDF mobilized to wage the Reunification War. Later Pillagers were upgraded with more cutting-edge Star League technology. Production of the Pillager halted not because its facility was destroyed, but the advanced Gauss rifle and XL engine production lines had been obliterated by the end of the Second Succession War. Curiously, HildCo did not restart production of the original PLG-1N, rather the Pillager lines only began production again in 3058 when advanced components were once again available for the PLG-3Z.

content.original: This variant was introduced by Clan Sea Fox on Solaris VII. Each arm has an improved heavy medium laser, while an ER small laser is in the center torso. Each side torso retains six machine guns found on the standard Piranha, and the single heat sinks have been replaced with double heat sinks to control the heat. The final change is an engine supercharger that allows the 'Mech to reach sprint speeds of 194 km/h. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Short Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.03

content.original: The Pouncer was originally a test bed design that was upgraded to combat specifications on the orders of then-IlKhan Ulric Kerensky, as it was realized that a more mobile 'Mech was needed when combating Inner Sphere forces. The Pouncer is built on a lightweight DSAM Endo 4 Endo Steel chassis and is powered by a 240 XL engine which gives it a maximum speed of 97.2 km/h. The 'Mech's mobility is enhanced with five Grandthrust Mk. Four jump jets that allow it to jump up to one hundred and fifty meters. For protection from enemy fire, the Pouncer has a respectable six tons of Forging ZM15 Ferro-Fibrous armor. Overall, the Pouncer is an excellent OmniMech with fifteen and a half tons of pod space, allowing it to carry a wide variety of weapons payloads.

content.original: The Pouncer was originally a test bed design that was upgraded to combat specifications on the orders of then-IlKhan Ulric Kerensky, as it was realized that a more mobile 'Mech was needed when combating Inner Sphere forces. The Pouncer is built on a lightweight DSAM Endo 4 Endo Steel chassis and is powered by a 240 XL engine which gives it a maximum speed of 97.2 km/h. The 'Mech's mobility is enhanced with five Grandthrust Mk. Four jump jets that allow it to jump up to one hundred and fifty meters. For protection from enemy fire, the Pouncer has a respectable six tons of Forging ZM15 Ferro-Fibrous armor. Overall, the Pouncer is an excellent OmniMech with fifteen and a half tons of pod space, allowing it to carry a wide variety of weapons payloads.

content.original: The Prey Seeker, manufactured by Achernar BattleMechs on Cahokia, was designed to be a high-speed scout and raider; while the Prey Seeker's mission profile speaks to MechWarriors who feel marginalized by the growth of combined-arms warfare, the unusual construction of the arms and the phenomenal speeds the 'Mech can reach echo the Dasher OmniMech first seen in the Inner Sphere during the Clan Invasion. Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.96

content.original: The -9G is Technicron's attempt to redefine the unit as a skirmisher. A light engine and an advanced endo-steel chassis allow for many improvements, including much-improved durability. Four targeting computer-assisted medium lasers provide all-around accurate firepower, backing the 'Mech's main armament of Clan Streak SRM racks. The Quickdraw -9G's most audacious feature is speed, with a supercharger and MASC combination allowing the 60-ton ’Mech to reach ludicrous speeds for its size. Quirk: Hyper-Extending Actuators Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.08

content.original: The Quickdraw was originally built in 2779 as a replacement for the Rifleman BattleMech. While it was unsuccessful in supplanting the Rifleman, over time the Quickdraw proved itself to be a good generalist 'Mech. Packing excellent firepower, solid armor protection and above-average speed, it quickly earned the respect of many MechWarriors and status as a workhorse in every Successor State's military.

content.original:
Based on specs from Operation Trapdoor, the 45 ton Rattlesnake II is a 10 ton upgrade of the original Rattlesnake Mech. Built by Clan Sea Fox for the AFFS during the waning years of the Dark Age, the RSN-1 is powered by a 315-rated Clan XL Engine. 8 tons of Clan Ferro-Fibrous armor and a Guardian ECM suite protect the Mech while Clan MASC increases the Mechs ground speed. A pair of Clan ER Medium Lasers backed up a quartet of Medium Lasers form the bulk of the Mechs arsenal with an ER Small Laser rounding out the weapons. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.03

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

content.original:
Its long-range striking ability and mobility allow the Rawhide to operate in a variety of roles, from heavy scout to skirmisher. Its primary weapon is an ER PPC mounted in the right arm, with a medium pulse laser riding sidecar. The entire arm is equipped with an actuator enhancement system that allows the arm-mounted weapons to fire with uncanny accuracy. An MML-9 occupies the left torso and is supplied by two tons of CASE-protected ammunition, which gives the pilot some options for their ammunition selection. 11 and a half tons of laser reflective armor protect the Mech, while five jump jets give it superb agility. Quirk: Reinforced Legs Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

content.original: The Rawhide is a medium BattleMech built by Kaiser Systems. It shares many similarities to the Scourge heavy BattleMech, and these similarities are more than superficial. In fact, some parts of the Rawhide come from a failed Scourge prototype. [3] Aside from the armor and actuator enhancement system, the Rawhide is constructed of fairly standard and common parts. While some may call this design choice a detriment, it is in fact an advantage on the combat and marketing battlefields, where ease of maintenance and lower costs make the Rawhide attractive to the mercenary market.

content.original:
The Razorback is a design that excels at little, but is similarly deficient in few areas. Though the design is rather slow for a 'Mech of its size, it is rarely the slowest 'Mech on the field, either. Because of the 'Mech's general reliance on ballistic and missile weaponry, it does not have to worry about overheating under normal circumstances but is dependent on supply trains. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

content.original: The Regent was born when Coventry Metal Works, the designers of the Hauptmann, managed to secure construction rights for an updated version of the original design after help by the ilKhanate. The efficiency of Clan technology meant that the Hauptmann could be replicated on a lighter chassis. Coventry technicians revised their schematics to employ the more readily available 270-rated engine and Clan heat sinks. The 'Mech shed five tons and a significant amount in production costs. Many MechWarriors refer to the resulting product as the Awesomann, a ridiculous yet accurate nickname for the imposing 'Mech, leading pilots of alternate configurations to call their rides Fafnirmann, Maulermann, and others.

Four ER Micro Lasers, two ER Medium Lasers and two ER PPC add a lot of extra punch to any alpha strike. The cooling capacity is however low, so continuous fire with all weapons is not recommended. Many MechWarriors refer to the resulting product as the Awesomann, a ridiculous yet accurate nickname for the imposing 'Mech, leading pilots of alternate configurations to call their rides Fafnirmann, Maulermann, and others.

Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.17

content.original:
The IIC 10 is hard to see as anything other than a conceptual failure. This variant of the IIC 2 has been recently spotted in Raven AMC units. The use of ProtoMech-class autocannons results in a platform that does nothing especially well, with the loss of range and accuracy a serious hindrance. The addition of a supercharger to enable pilots to close range is insufficient to balance things out. Quirk: Integrated Searchlight Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

content.original:
The recent IIC 9 is a quixotic effort. In some regards it embraces the anti-air role, with an enhanced targeting suite. Coolant pods deal with intermittent heat spikes resulting from periods of intense fire amid the relative calm experienced by anti-air units. However, the choice of reflective armor is an odd one. It offers superb protection against the common strafing attack, but in turn increases the vulnerability to equally common bomb strikes. Time will tell if pilots find the trade-off worthwhile. Quirk: Integrated Searchlight Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

content.original: The Sagittaire is built to fight in the confines of an urban battlefield. Weighing in at a massive ninety-five tons, the Sagittaire started production in mid-3063 and began to trickle out to units clamoring for close combat 'Mechs in the midst of the FedCom Civil War. As a power source, the 'Mech has a 285 XL engine. The XL engine saves weight at the cost of survivability and gives the 'Mech a top speed of 54.0 km/h while its mobility is enhanced with three jump jets, allowing the 'Mech to jump up to ninety meters.

content.original:
The SGT-14R is an almost total rebuild using Clan grade weapons and components, leading to improved performance on the battlefield and the 'Mech is now seen as key to rebuilding the AFFS, with every new 'Mech flowing to the surrounding Draconis March Worlds. Two Large VSP Lasers and an ER PPC serve as the main weapons, while three ER Medium Lasers and three Small Pulse Laser provide secondary fire capabilities. All weapons are routed through an advanced 8 ton targeting computer, ensuring the optimal weapons performance is always ensured. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Short Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.17

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

content.original: One of the first mass production QuadMechs, the 55 ton Scorpion entered production in 2570 as an infantry support unit. Shunned by most MechWarriors due to its notoriously unstable gait, the Scorpion would nevertheless see uninterrupted use throughout the Succession Wars and beyond. The Scorpion 1BR is powered by a 330-rated Light Fusion Engine giving it a top speed of 97 km/h. An ER PPC and a Streak SRM-6 form the Mechs weapons load. MASC provides improved speed for short periods. Quirk: Quad Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

content.original: The Scourge is a mid thirty-second century heavy BattleMech, which is utilized as a general purpose combat unit and as well as a heavy scout.
content.prevOriginal: The Scourge is a mid thirty-second century heavy BattleMech, which is utilized as a general purpose combat unit and as well as a heavy scout.
content.content: The Scourge is a mid thirty-second century heavy BattleMech, which is utilized as a general purpose combat unit and as well as a heavy scout.

content.original:
The WF1 model of the Scourge is powered by a 325-rated fusion engine, which allows this heavy 'Mech the speed to engage moderately-swift combat units. The 'Mech's four Jump Jets gives it the tactical flexibility to outmaneuver many units that it can't outpace. Protecting its vital components during battle, the 'Mech's hull is fitted with 12.5 tons of light ferro-fibrous armor. The Scourge's main weapon is an Gauss rifle, located in its left arm. This weapon is limited to sixteen rounds of ammunition. The bulk of its close-in firepower comes from four ER medium lasers in the right arm, and a single medium pulse laser located in the left arm. The array of ER medium lasers found in the 'Mech's right arm uses an advanced tech actuator enhancement system to allow the weapons better accuracy. Quirk: Reinforced Legs Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

Arm Actuator Limits: Right Lower, Left Upper

A further development by the Sentinel line made by the Lyran Commonwealth, the -7K mounts a PPC in the left arm and a MRM-20 launcher in the right torso. A 240 XL engine, endo steel chassis and Ferro-Fibrous armor frees up enough weight to also add a MASC, a Capaciator for the PPC and CASE protection for the MRM ammunition. Quirk: Improved Communications Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.02

Arm Actuator Limit: Left Upper

It carries an ER Large Laser, an ATM-6, and two ER Medium Lasers. It has a top speed of 96 km/h, and can jump 180 meters at a time. Особенность: Боевые кулаки Множитель стоимости высадки: 1.09

Лимит приводов рук: Left Upper

content.original: Boss, these Shadow Hawk IICs are a sleek redesign of the classic Shadow Hawk.  They are lighter and faster than the original but still manage to pack a similar punch.

content.original: A Dark Age overhaul built by House Davion to counter the exotic armor types in use among the DCMS, the Shadow Hawk 6D debuted in 3141. Built around a standard 275-rated Fusion Core, the Mech uses a combination of Endo Steel and Ferro-Fibrous armor to fit a Large Re-Engineered Laser in the Left Torso and a Medium Re-Engineered Laser in the Right Arm. An MML-5 with CASE-II protected munitions bay and a Streak SRM-2 (I-OS) round out the design. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

content.original: The Shogun began production before the Star League fell and eventually was thought to be lost to the Succession Wars. The 'Mech suddenly reappeared when Wolf's Dragoons showed up in 3005, bringing a sizable number of Shoguns with them. The 'Mech was intended to be used as an urban combat 'Mech where its jumping distance and slow speed makes it able to easily traverse the close confines of a city. Though the Dragoons brought Shoguns with them from the Clan Homeworlds, they could not reach a deal with any manufacturer that met their desires, so by 3068 the total count of the 'Mech in the Inner Sphere was reduced to two, both of which were in the hands of Wannamaker's Widowmakers, taken as salvage from the Dragoons.

content.original:
The new Shogun C 3 is firmly aimed at tradition-minded Clan customers. Marketed for the same niche as the old Warhawk, which still captures the minds and hearts of so many, the new Shogun increases speed at the cost of the enormous short-range damage potential of earlier variants. There are few complaints, as the C 3 may be the most balanced Shogun to date. The new Artemis V FCS and the PPC capacitor forced a replacement of the venerable original HartfordCo targeting system with a far more modern and advanced one. The new targeting solution is amongst the best available, and is one of the reasons behind the success of this new variant. Despite carrying seven tons of ammunition, the 'Mech is surprisingly tough, thanks to CASE II. Quirk: Barrel Fist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.21

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

content.original: The production Skinwalker removes the controversial triple-strength myomers of its prototype Ryoken III-XP. MechWarriors appreciated the speed boost, but the interface cockpit system made them more hesitant than other Clan MechWarriors to engage in physical combat. This rendered the myomers moot. Like its Stormcrow progenitor, the Skinwalker excels in a cavalry role, bringing heavy firepower to bear with speed and stunning accuracy

The Prime configuration is armed with two pairs of Extended Range Large and Medium Pulse Lasers mounted on each of the 'Mech's arm actuators. Backing up the lasers is a pair of 6-tubed SRM launchers which are mounted in the torso sides. The launchers are supplied by two tons of ammunition from the center torso. To help alleviate the weapon system's heat burden, two additional Double Heat Sinks are added. Quirk: Stable Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.06

content.original: A prototype OmniMech built on the success of the Stormcrow line, fielded by Clan Wolf for trials before going into full production. Using a combination of a 330-rated Extra-Light Fusion Engine and TSM, the 'Mech is able to achieve speeds up to 110 km/h. Perhaps the most startling innovation included in this design is the Clan Interface Armor, which allows a MechWarrior to interface with their 'Mech while being completely armored should they be forced to eject. This combination interface allows the Ryoken III pilot's a degree of control in combat, and removes the need to have a Gyro mounted in the 'Mech. This technology was thought to have been lost at the time of Skinwalker's baptism in combat by Inner Sphere powers. In addition to having its pilot encased in a power-armor interface, the Mech's hull is protected by 11.5 tons of Ferro-Lamellor Armor.

content.original:
Fast, quick, and deadly, the B configuration is fitted with medium and short range weapons and a Supercharger to help it get into range. The arsenal includes five Improved Heavy Medium Lasers. These weapons are fitted in the side, center torsos and right arm. The main weapon for close-up combat is a Class-20 Ultra Autocannon mounted on the right arm, with three tons of ammunition protected by CASE II. Enhancing the Mech's survival is a Clan-produced ECM suite. Quirk: Stable Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.06

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

content.original:
The D configuration is fitted with a mix of short-range and melee weapons. Long-range firepower comes from a Clan-produced Class-2 Rotary Autocannon mounted in the left arm with two tons of ammunition. Other weapons include a right torso-mounted Bombast Laser, a single ER Medium Laser in the right arm, and pairs of two ER Small and ER Micro Lasers mounted in the left and center torso section respectively. The configuration's mêlée weapon is a BatteMech Lance. Quirk: Stable Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.06

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

content.original:
The Sojourner is a simple 'Mech designed by Clan Wolf-in-Exile after the staggering loss at Arc-Royal. The 'Mech went through several design phases resulting in a final design that was both easy to maintain and pilot, with the primary use being to teach younger MechWarriors the trade of 'Mech-on-'Mech combat. As a result the pilots of these 'Mechs have a considerably higher survival rate compared to other, harder to pilot 'Mechs like the Linebacker. The base variant of the Sojourner carries a Gauss Rifle, with the compliment of a single ER Large Laser and a Plasma Cannon. The combination of 3 Jump Jets, a Supercharger and an AES system makes the 'Mech quite mobile on the battlefield despite its somewhat underpowered 240-rated Fusion Core. A CASE II system and a single external Double Heat Sink finishes up the design. Quirk: Easy to Pilot Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

content.original:
Based on the original Star League-era BattleMech, the Stalker II is a complete top-to-bottom redesign that takes advantage of technological advancements gained since the last era of open warfare ended. These efforts resulted in the Stalker II, giving troops an incredibly durable assault 'Mech that is able to withstand horrific amounts of punishment while keeping the original Stalker's success, which was it's variants that used Star League-era fire control systems. In order to recapture this particular aspect of the old design, the Stalker II was fitted with a modern Targeting Computer. Quirk: Combat Computer Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.21

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

content.original:
Irian developed a new variant of its classic Stalker after its latest 'Mech, the Stalker II, was snubbed by some customers due to it's limited weapon flexibility. The -9F keeps the Stalker II's hardened armor, and Irian addressed concerns regarding damage output on the modern battlefield by making its primary weapons Clan grade. Irian could supply equivalent large pulse lasers to augment the traditional Magna medium lasers. They negotiated a deal with Skate Khanate's Beta Aimag for missile launchers and sensors in return for a percentage of the production output. The STK-9F's combination of durability and destructive potential made it a common sight in this region of the Inner Sphere. Quirk: Combat Computer Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

content.original: The Starslayer was a mainstay of the Lyran military when the 'Mech was resurrected in the thirty-first century. This highly mobile energy weapon platform can stay in the field nearly indefinitely with minimal resupply, making it an optimal raider. Upgraded Starslayers played a key role in Task Force Kingbreaker on Buena. Precision strikes disabled the equipment of the Third Collective Guards at Fort Buena without killing their occupants, whom the LCAF regarded as misguided fellow Lyran citizens

content.original:
The Star Python poses little threat to an enemy of greater size or moderately respectable armor. The Scorpion Empire employs the ’Mech in groups, enhancing the threat through numbers rather than via armament. Though their current numbers remain low, an unverified report indicates Star Pythons are being deployed in Trinary-sized hunting packs. The combined might of many light ’Mechs delivers through synergy what each lacks individually. It doubles as a fast scout, combining excellent speed with limited jump capability. Quirk: Nimble Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

A sleek, mobile, and versatile design, the Clan Stormcrow was long suspected to be one of the first OmniMechs produced by the Clans. Developed by Clan Snow Raven this variant is unique in that it's intended for vacuum operations. Equipped with an all energy weapon loadout and Laser Heat sinks to properly cool the mech. 4 Improved Jump Jets makes sure the mech can easily maneuver in space. Quirk: Stable Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.06

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

content.original:
A 55 ton OmniMech that blends a lethal cocktail of speed and firepower, the Stormcrow is a common sight in many clan Toumans. Powered by a 330-rated XL Engine and built with a combination of an Endo Steel chassis and Ferro-Fibrous armor, the Stormcrow has 19 tons of pod space available. The Stormcrow T is armed with paired Large Pulse Lasers and ER Small Pulses. A Medium Pulse Laser, Supercharger and Light Active Probe round out the design. Quirk: Stable Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.06

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

content.original: Needing to build up its forces after establishing the Wolf Empire and wanting a more generalist unit than the Skinwalker, Clan Wolf's Ramiel Bekker created the Stormwolf in collaboration with Clan Sea Fox by modifying the Wendigo to the Clan's exacting specifications. The 'Mech was designed with the intention of striking a balance between firepower and speed, and chief among Bekker's modifications was the addition of fixed mobility-enhancing equipment in order to shape the 'Mech's role in combat, as well as relocating the 'Mech's cockpit to the head. This relocation's associated visual changes gave the 'Mech a more canid or ursid appearance, bringing it more in line with the earlier Wulfen and Warwolf aesthetically.

Packing advanced electronics, this configuration mounts a Watchdog CEWS in the left torso along with a targeting computer in the right, giving the 'Mech a technological edge on the battlefield. Linked to the targeting computer is an ER large laser in the right torso and a trio of ER medium lasers spread across the right arm and both side torsos. In addition, the 'Mech carries a flamer in the right arm, along with four extra double heat sinks that are just about sufficient to handle the load from its weapons. Quirk: Distracting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni
