content.original: Needing to build up its forces after establishing the Wolf Empire and wanting a more generalist unit than the Skinwalker, Clan Wolf's Ramiel Bekker created the Stormwolf in collaboration with Clan Sea Fox by modifying the Wendigo to the Clan's exacting specifications. The 'Mech was designed with the intention of striking a balance between firepower and speed, and chief among Bekker's modifications was the addition of fixed mobility-enhancing equipment in order to shape the 'Mech's role in combat, as well as relocating the 'Mech's cockpit to the head. This relocation's associated visual changes gave the 'Mech a more canid or ursid appearance, bringing it more in line with the earlier Wulfen and Warwolf aesthetically.

Its primary armament is a rotary AC/5 with three tons of ammo protected by CASE II, while for shorter ranges it carries a single ER medium laser. A light TAG is carried for target designation. content.original: The Striker was originally commissioned by the SLDF high command in 2571 for non-Royal SLDF units. Along with the Stalker, the Striker became one of the most common 'Mechs in service. The Striker was built with the intent of being rugged and reliable, but more importantly, allowed House Lords to reserve their precious and limited numbers of assault BattleMechs for their own personal armies. In this way, the Striker may have been the show of good faith the House Lords needed to make the Star League work. In spite of the 'Mech's dependability, the Striker was marginal compared with later assault BattleMechs, and was eventually relegated to serving in militia units, with the highest concentration ending up on the rimward edge of the Terran Hegemony. After the destruction of the Stormvanger lines in 2867, fewer than 300 Strikers were known to exist in 3058

content.original:
The Summoner is a highly mobile heavy OmniMech that is commonly used in a wide variety of roles. Barely a second generation OmniMech, the Jade Falcons introduced the Summoner just after becoming the first Clan to win OmniMech technology from Clan Coyote in 2863. The main firepower for the J variant is provided by a HAG-40 in the left arm. This is supported by twin Improved Heavy Medium Lasers in the right arm. A Light Active Probe is mounted in the right torso to enhance detection capabilities. Quirk: Improved Communications Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.11

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

content.original: Hey Boss, the clans call these things the Summoner but I've always called em' the Thor.  These OmniMechs are a tad light on available pod space for their weight class and those early structural mounts are not compatible with anything else. But with that huge engine and lots of jumpjet hardpoints you will be hard pressed to find many 'Mechs its size that are faster.

A Clan ER Medium laser acts as a secondary weapon. Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.11

content.original: A second-line Clan 'Mech feared by many Inner Sphere pilots, the Supernova seems to be an advanced version of the Black Hawk, though it was actually developed before that venerable OmniMech. Plans to replace the King Crab's loadout with clusters of Large Lasers grew from a shortage of autocannon ammunition. The first prototypes met with little success due to the King Crab's integral Ferro-fibrous armor, but gave rise to a lighter and leaner new design which eventually became the Supernova.

content.original: The Swordsman was an early Federated Suns medium-class BattleMech which was originally built in 2463 as House Davion's third in-house BattleMech design. The design was tainted by heavy use in the Davion Civil War of 2525-2540. Eventually, production ended and the design was relegated to the dustbin of history. However, in the 3060s, the mech was put back into production by House Davion to supplement their forces in the FedCom Civil War. The SWD-2 is the stock production design, mounting heavy armor and firepower for the tonnage: 7.5 tons of armor and a grab-bag mix of guns including an AC/5, LRM-5, SRM-4, two Medium Lasers, and a Small Laser. Quirk: Integrated Searchlight Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.02

The SWD-2 is the stock production design, mounting heavy armor and firepower for the tonnage: 7.5 tons of armor and a grab-bag mix of guns including an AC/5, LRM-5, SRM-4, two Medium Lasers, and a Small Laser. Особенность: Встроенный прожектор Множитель стоимости высадки: 1.02

content.original:
With a noticeable lack of OmniMechs designed in the Federated Suns, Field Marshal Duke George Hasek went over the heads of the Department of the Quartermaster and commissioned Kallon Industries to design an assault OmniMech and backed the project with his own financial resources. The resulting 'Mech is a force to be reckoned with on the modern battlefield. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

content.content:
В связи с ощутимой нехваткой собственных омнимехов в Федеративных Солнцах, фельдмаршал герцог Джордж Хасек, обратившись к руководителям Department of the Quartermaster, поручил компании Kallon Industries разработать штурмовой омнимех и поддержал проект собственными финансовыми средствами. Получившийся в результате мех - это сила, с которой стоит считаться на современном поле боя. Особенность: Прост в обслуживании Множитель стоимости высадки: 1.1

content.original:
The 'Mech features a 300-rated XL engine with MASC and a Supercharger, allowing it to reach high speeds normally found on lighter machines. Enhancing its mobility further are five jump jets, giving it a jump capacity of 150 meters. The Thresher Mk II's armament features a mix of long range and short range options. Its main battery of guns consists of an ER PPC with a LRM-15, supplied with two tons of ammunition. At shorter ranges, a large pulse laser coupled with a SRM-4 and flamer are available for use. Its ammunition is protected by CASE II, greatly decreasing damage to the right torso from ammo explosions and allowing the XL engine to continue operating with little fear of damage. Clan Sea Fox chose to protect the 'Mech with 9.5 tons of Gamma Special Reflective armor. This armor gives the 'Mech resistance to energy weapons, but makes it more vulnerable to artillery and some ballistic weapons. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Medium Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.12

Arm Actuator Limit: Left Lower

content.original: The Thresher Mk II is a Heavy Clan BattleMech designed as a skirmisher by Clan Sea Fox. This is a remodeled/refitted version of the venerable Thresher. The Thresher Mk II came about when a number of these 'Mechs were produced during the Dark Age Era and Clan Sea Fox Merchants were unable to sell them. Negotiations with Clan Wolf Khan Alaric Ward paved the way toward a sale, but only if the 'Mechs were refitted to Clan Wolf's specifications, which included arm actuators that the original design never featured.

content.original: The 13U carries a Snub-Nose PPC in each arm. Both side torsos house a pair of MML-3s, capable of firing twelve missiles per volley. An engine Supercharger can combine with heat activated Triple Strength Myomer to sprint at speeds of 108 km/h. Twelve double heat sinks are carried, and the Endo Steel chassis is protected by twenty tons of Ballistic Reinforced Armor. The right torso carries two tons of missile ammunition in a CASE II protected bay. Quirk: Accurate Weapon - Energy Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

content.original: The Thug was designed by Maltex Corporation as a direct competitor to the popular Warhammer BattleMech. First seeing production in 2572, the Thug sought to directly address some of the challenges which faced the Warhammer, chief of which was to increase armor protection without sacrificing firepower.

content.original: The Thunderbolt IIA is a one-off project to create a larger version of the 'Mech. Weighing in at 90 tons of total weight it really is just a larger and slower version of the original, and according to some MechWarriors worse.

content.original: Also known as 'Avenging Annie', this 3138 variant is designed for front-line combat. Replacing the LRMs are a Gauss Rifle, a Large Pulse Laser, two Medium Pulse Lasers, and an ER Large Laser. An XL engine and a half-ton armor reduction allows room for this armament array and jump jets. As of 3140, only one 'Mech of this variant existed, a custom Arc-Royal MechWorks refit/rebuild for Ann-Marie Dalmas, but there were indications that Clan Hell's Horses were working to duplicate it. Quirk: Quad Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.21

content.original: Clan Hell's Horses originally conceived of the Thunder Stallion as a totem 'Mech, along the lines of the Mandrill. After the poor performance of other totem designs, however, that aspect was downplayed to the point that only the rear legs retain any of the equine aesthetic styling that was supposed to be such an important aspect of the 'Mech. True to the emphasis on combined arms warfare that the Horses value, the Thunder Stallion is an assault 'Mech that is designed to support what would be considered secondary forces in any other Clan. Since it was designed to work with infantry, the Thunder Stallion's top speed of 54 km/h is roughly equivalent to the speed that an Elemental Battle Armor can move.

A missile boat configuration, the Timber Wolf T is armed with an Artemis V FCS-enhanced LRM-20 rack in each side torso, supported by a Improved Heavy Medium Laser and ER Medium Laser in each arm and a pair of ER Small Lasers and a single ER Small Pulse Laser in the torsos. Six tons of LRM rounds and two extra double heat sinks give it good field endurance. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Medium Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.12

content.original:
Produced in 2546, the Toro was the Taurian Concordant’s first battlemech design. Based on captured Firebees, the Toro is a long range support mech. Armed with a PPC and a pair of LRM-5s the Toro carried two tons of ammo and 10 single heat sinks. The last Toro factory was demolished in 2598 by invading Star League troops and production would not resume until the Word of Blake Jihad. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

Arm Actuator Limit: Left Lower

content.original:
A further Upgrade of the B-9, the B-12 variant of the Toro keeps the MML and Light PPC, but replaces the Medium Laser with two ER Medium Lasers. By using an Endo Steel chassis and XL engine, the fusion core is upgraded to a 210 rating. As the icing on the cake the 'Mech always brings double heat sinks unlike its predecessor. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.98

content.content: Produced in 2546, the Toro was the Taurian Concordant’s first battlemech design. Based on captured Firebees, the Toro is a long range support mech. Armed with a PPC and a pair of LRM-5s the Toro carried two tons of ammo and 10 single heat sinks. The last Toro factory was demolished in 2598 by invading Star League troops and production would not resume until the Word of Blake Jihad.

content.original:
One of the latest UrbanMech variants, the UM-R96 is an evolution of the -R80. It drops all the weaponry bar the Snub-Nose PPC to mount the hardened armor of the -R93 model. The standard small laser remains, although now of the X-pulse variety. This creates an incredibly tough 'Mech with minimal logistics needs, which is perfectly suited to combat in an urban environment—but nowhere else. Quirk: 360° Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

content.original: A complete redesign of the 'Mech, this model carries MASC and a Supercharger to reach speeds of 150 km/h briefly. This makes up for the fact that it can't jump. Each leg mounts a single A-Pod, the left arm carries a Plasma Cannon with a ton of ammunition, and the right arm carries an ER PPC. Each side torso carries five Micro Pulse Lasers. All weapons are tied into the typical Targeting Computer. complete redesign of the 'Mech, this model carries MASC and a Supercharger to reach speeds of 150 km/h briefly. content.original: The Vapor Eagle features an eclectic and close-ranged weapons load-out, mounting a Large Pulse Laser in its right arm, supported by a single Machine Gun, two Streak SRM-2s and three Medium Pulse Lasers split between its side torsos and rounded out by a trio of Machine Guns in a handgun shaped housing in the left arm. The addition of a Targeting Computer makes its firepower even more deadly as long as it can get its weapons into range. Eleven Double Heat Sinks, half a ton of machine gun ammunition and one Streak missiles are more than adequate for the average Clan trial.

content.original:
One of the few joint GM/Blackwell product lines salvaged after the Jihad, GM put the Victor back into production in the early 3080s. The current -12D variant utilizes the endo-steel frame and light engine of some predecessors. It also shares a number of components and weapons with the Templar III. A targeting computer improves the Gauss rifle’s accuracy, while a heavy-duty gyro and CASE II improve its durability. The simplicity of this variant enables it to be supplied as a refit kit for various earlier models. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

content.original:
Recently deployed in considerable numbers in the CCAF, the Vindicator -7L returns the 'Mech to its rugged, generalist nature. While most of the package remains unchanged, Ferro-Fibrous armor increases protection for less weight, while a reinforced chassis and CASE II greatly improve durability. The biggest surprise is the addition of a Clan Kingston ER PPC, supplied by Skate Khanate. The Capellans adapted it to work with the Vindicator's simple but effective cooling jacket. Now longer-ranged, harder-hitting, and possessing greater endurance, the -7L has proven to be a deadly combatant in the Capellan March and along the Free Worlds border. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.03

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

content.original: The Vindicator is one of the most well-known Capellan Confederation BattleMechs. This workhorse of the CCAF was originally built in 2826 between the First and Second Succession War to maximize the effectiveness of the Confederation's surviving production capabilities and fulfill as many roles as possible. Designed by committee, the Vindicator's 'jack-of-all-trades' nature means it does not excel in any one role but fulfills them adequately. With almost all of its components produced on Capella, the Vindicator is also cheap, easy to mass produce, and quick to repair with a ready supply of spare parts.

content.original: The new VP-9 sheds the straight-ahead brawler reputation and immobilizes its prey with a quartet of Sea Fox-sourced plasma cannons, stabilized via actuator enhancement. It then closes the distance to deliver the coup de grace with its brutal mace. This new variant has proven formidable on modern battlefields, despite its slow top speed. Quirk: Improved Communications Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

content.original: Almost 300 years after its original creation, the Viper was reborn in the Republic era. But not because of demand for a forgotten unit, but because a stockpile of blazers was discovered in a Kallon warehouse in 3123. Kallon engineers were then developing a new 'Mech for the RAF. They, like their predecessors, realized that the Viper was ideal for the surplus weapons. Viper schematics survived in their database, and existing Crusader tooling could be readily adapted.

Introduced in 2940, the Viper is a 40-ton OmniMech that emphasizes speed and armor, with only 8.5 tons of podspace available for weapons. A 320-rated XL Engine powers the Viper and 8 Jump Jets are hardwired into the chassis, further improving the mobility. The Viper J is armed with 4 ER Micro Lasers and 3 ATM-3’s. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Long Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.03

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

A 320-rated XL Engine powers the Viper and 8 Jump Jets are hardwired into the chassis, further improving the mobility. The Viper K is armed with 3 AP Gauss Rifles and a pair of ER Medium Lasers. A Tag and an Active Probe improve the Viper’s Scouting capabilities while an Angel ECM suite shields the Viper from detection. Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.03.

content.original:
A custom configuration used by the Blessed Order's revived First Division's Unending Faith III, the Vulture III BLO carries paired LRM-15 racks in each side torso, supported at short range by the chin-turret mounted ER Medium Lasers, an ER Medium and ER Small Laser in the left arm and an Inner Sphere Light PPC in the right arm. Carrying four tons of LRM reloads, the effectiveness of the BLO is enhanced by the inclusion of an Improved C3 Computer. Quirk: Variable Range Targeting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

content.original:
The original Warhammer was designed as an assault BattleMech. However, it had been superseded by later and heavier 'Mech designs, though it remained a powerful weapons platform. The Clans wisely maintained and built on this solid frame a real assault 'Mech, the Warhammer IIC. This version uses an XXL Engine to reach top speeds of 86 km/h. Its weapon load hearkens back to the original Warhammer, carrying ER PPCs in the arms and a single ER Medium Laser and ER Small Laser in the left and right torso. An SRM-6 is also carried in the right torso, and an ECM Suite disrupts enemy communications and targeting. This version is protected by Heat-Dissipating Armor. Quirk: Integrated Searchlight Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.24

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

The original Warhammer was designed as an assault BattleMech. However, it had been superseded by later and heavier 'Mech designs, though it remained a powerful weapons platform. The Clans wisely maintained and built on this solid frame a real assault 'Mech, the Warhammer IIC. This version uses an XXL Engine to reach top speeds of 86 km/h. Its weapon load hearkens back to the original Warhammer, carrying ER PPCs in the arms and a single ER Medium Laser and ER Small Laser in the left and right torso. An SRM-6 is also carried in the right torso, and an ECM Suite disrupts enemy communications and targeting. This version is protected by Heat-Dissipating Armor. Особенность: Встроенный прожектор Множитель стоимости высадки: 1.24

Лимит приводов рук: Left Lower, Right Lower

content.original:
Known and revered across the Inner Sphere and beyond, the Warhammer is the pre-eminent heavy Mech. Debuting in 2515, the 70-ton Mech is a solid blend of firepower and mobility designed to outfight almost any opponent. Powered by a 280-rated Light Engine and armored in Ballistic Reinforced armor, the Warhammer WHM-10K is armed with a pair of ER PPCs. Paired Medium Lasers, ER Small Lasers, Clan Machine Guns and a Streak SRM-6 deter opponents from closing in. Clan DHS and CASE II round out the design. Quirk: Integrated Searchlight Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

content.original: The War Crow is a Heavy OmniMech fielded by Clan Snow Raven. Commissioned by Khan Sterling McKenna, she had implemented development of the War Crow as a part of efforts to prepare her Clan for a war she believed could end up coming to the Alliance. The War Crow was designed to become the backbone of a newly revived Touman of Clan Snow Raven. Powered by the Redline 350 Extra-Light Fusion Engine, the War Crow is designed to move at a modest pace with other combatants. The Snow Raven Scientist caste designed the 'Mech with the latest in their Clan's armor protection, 15.5 tons of Ferro-Lamellor. While still a heavy OmniMech, the Ravens chose to give the Mech a fully functional hand actuator in the right arm.

content.original:
The primary configuration is set up with balanced weapons, making it a generalist. The Prime's long-range weapons include a pair of Clan built 15-tubed Long-Range Missile Launchers teamed with an Extended Range PPC, which is further enhanced with a PPC Capacitor. For close-in combat, the Mech has pair of both ER Medium Lasers and Medium Pulse Lasers in the arms and side torsos. The missile launchers are supplied with 4 tons of reloads, split between arm-mounted ammo bins. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Short Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.11

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

content.original: A 20 ton reconnaissance Mech, the Wasp has been in continuous production since its introduction in 2471; making it one of the most common Mechs in existence. A Wolf Empire Mech, the Wasp WSP-C is powered by a 120-rated Fusion Core and equipped with 5 Jump Jets. An ER Large Laser is the Mechs main weapon, with an RL-10 for close combat. Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.03

content.original: The White Raven 2 uses more advanced technology than the original. An XXL engine maintains the top ground speed of 86 km/h, and eight Improved Jump Jets allow the 'Mech to cover 240 meters per jump. Like the White Raven it carries a Targeting Computer for its weapons. The armament includes two ER Small Lasers in each arm, a Large Pulse Laser in each side torso, and two Medium Pulse Lasers in the center torso. Ten double heat sinks are equipped. This variant, unlike the first White Raven, is protected by standard armor instead of Ferro-Lamellor. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Short Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.17

This variant, unlike the first White Raven, is protected by standard armor instead of Ferro-Lamellor. Особенность: Улучшенное наведение - Short Множитель стоимости высадки: 1.17

content.original:
Following the HPG blackout and the splintering of the Republic, TharHes Industries hastily reopened the Wolfhound line that had been destroyed during the Jihad. Based upon the WLF-5, albeit with TharHes’s original stylings, the -6S variant drops the MASC system and the entire weapons array. A large re-engineered laser is mounted in the right arm, with enhanced actuators to provide increased accuracy. As with the -3S, three ER medium lasers provide backup. A small X-pulse laser covers the rear. The Wolfhound is once again a match for the Combine’s Panther Quirk: Accurate Weapon - Energy Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

content.original: House Davion focused on boosting mobility while fielding upgraded autocannons. The haphazard WVR-7D was followed by several Project Phoenix models before the Talon factory disappeared in nuclear fire during the Jihad. Not content to lose a defining medium ’Mech after the success of the SHD-6D, the AFFS financed rapid production of the WVR-10D at Kallon of Wernke. Its performance compares well with the initial run of Conjurers built at Thermopolis for the Wolf Empire. Quirk: Improved Communications Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

content.original: The Wraith marked Curtiss Militech's entry into BattleMech production. When the design was announced, many felt that the design would be little more than a walking water cooler. What the critics got was a shock. The Wraith is a 'Mech that, when properly employed, can wreak havoc on an enemy with its astounding speed and maneuverability. It is built around a massive LTV 385 XL Engine that allows it to reach speeds of just under 119 km/h. The Wraith has a simple, yet effective, pulse weapons payload. Pulse laser weaponry allows the Mech to negate most of the side effects on accuracy that are introduced by the Wraith's heavy use of jump jets, making it incredibly accurate and powerful for such a lightly armed Mech.

content.original: The XNS-01-A is a unlicensed attempt at copying the XNT-7O, produced by at an unknown Deep Periphery location by an unknown party. Being sold for considerably less than the official version, it is not unusual to see it with different pirate bands. Due to being an illegal copy of the real design, the Clan tech weapons have been replaced by older IS counterparts and the engine core has been shrunken considerably. The cooling has also worsened, as the double heat sinks were changed to single heat sinks to cut costs further. Quirk: Quad Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18

content.original: The Xanthos was first introduced by the Capellan Confederation in 2564, designed by a young engineer named Dr. David Harrison. Working for Hollis Inc., he pioneered the technology to create four-legged BattleMechs. This technological advancement that later allowed the research into the Scorpion and Goliath enabled the Xanthos to get on the field. It was presented to the Terran Hegemony for review after the cancellation of the Catapult. Hollis pushed to have this 'Mech presented against Dr. Harrison's wishes in a bid to maintain financial solvency. Clumsy and stiff, the 'Mech failed to win the contract from the Star League purchasing committee.

Introduced in 3144, the Yinghuochong is a 35 ton Capellan Confederation light Mech. Built using a modified Firebee chassis, the Yinghuochong is designed as a scout killer and recon mech. Built around a 210-rated XL Engine and armored in Light Ferro-Fibrous; the Yinghuochong YHC-3E is armed with a Clan ER PPC and a TAG. A Remote Sensor Dispenser and Improved Jump Jets improve the Yinghuochongs scouting capability. Quirk: Improved Cooling Jacket - PPC Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.98

content.original: First introduced in 3096, this post-Jihad design was created by Clan Wolf as a cheap anti-aircraft platform. Slow and heavily armored, the Aesir is often set into static positions where its relatively slow speed is not considered a liability. Used by Clan Hell's Horses, this version of the Aesir replaces the LB-X autocannons with a single turret mounted HAG/40. It carries six tons of ammunition and retains the armor protection and Armored Motive System of the original Aesir. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 3/5 Hex: 90/150 Meters. Armor: Ferro-Fibrous (C) Structure: Structure Values A S Front 200 30 Left 200 30 Right 200 30 Rear 190 30 Turret 185 30 Total 975 150 Quirk: Anti-Air Targeting

content.original: The Laser Bellona was massively upgraded with an XL engine, armored motive system, Streak LRMs, and a targeting computer This update gives Support Cizins a run for their money. In the late 3060s, under Khan James Cobb's command, Clan Hell's Horses began preparation for a renewed presence in the Inner Sphere. The scientist caste saw this as an opportunity to create a new cavalry vehicle, which they called the Bellona. Designed as a striker and flanker, the Bellona carries enough firepower on a nimble enough frame to keep up with even the fastest-advancing lines. The original specs called for tracks, but test pilots for the vehicle cited that 'speed is armor', which led to the Bellona being redesigned as a hovertank. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 10/15 Hex: 300/450 Meters. Armor: Ferro-Fibrous (C) Structure: Structure Values A S Front 160 25 Left 145 25 Right 145 25 Rear 105 25 Turret 160 25 Total 715 125 Quirk: Nimble

content.original: After the Word of Blake was defeated in the Jihad, Maxwell-Pulaski Motors modified the design slightly and produced it for the Republic of the Sphere in 3084. The main differences are the removal of its Blakist features. The infantry bay was reduced to four tons, and the C3i system was replaced by a C3 slave unit. The machine gun ammunition was reduced to half a ton. All these changes increased the pod space available to the RAF Bollas by four and a half tons, but the turret can only mount fifteen tons of equipment. The Stealth Armor was retained, as was the Guardian ECM suite. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 5/8 Hex: 150/240 Meters. content.original: The Bulldog could be called a 'Jack of all trades', featuring a classic layout of one main gun and a few secondary weapons. It is easy to repair and said to be a reliable and cheap asset for any field commander that needs a backbone for his vehicle forces. Fuel Cell: Improved vehicle engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 5/8 Hex: 150/240 Meters. Armor: Hardened Structure: Structure Values A S Front 140 30 Left 110 30 Right 110 30 Rear 110 30 Turret 110 30 Total 580 150 Quirk: Main Battle Tank

content.original: A monster of a unit, these heavily armed VTOL's are the epitome of the Gunship. Line breakers and fire support platforms, these are usually found in the front of an attack. Carrying an array of ranged weapons, the Assault VTOL is designed to smash targets at range. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 6/9 Hex: 180/270 Meters. Armor: Armor Structure: Structure Values A S Front 220 42 Left 140 42 Right 140 42 Rear 95 42 Total 620 210 Quirk: Integrated Searchlight

Штурмовой VTOL, несущий на борту целый комплекс стрелкового оружия, предназначен для поражения целей на расстоянии. Термоядерный: дорогой двигатель, работающий в вакууме. content.original: Despite the original being introduced in 2564 updated Condors are still in production as of the start of the 32nd Century. Substantial armor of at least six tons and various mid and long range weapon packages keep the Condor relevant. A heavy cavalry unit designed for rapid reaction to a shifting battle, the Condor was one of the few heavy hover tanks available at the time of it's introduction. This immense hovercraft is capable of a flank speed of 129 km/h and a cruising speed of 86 km/h, making it one of the fastest vehicles in its weight class. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 8/12 Hex: 240/360 Meters. Armor: Armor Structure: Structure Values A S Front 180 25 Left 140 25 Right 140 25 Rear 120 25 Turret 140 25 Total 720 125 Quirk: Quick Off The Line

content.original: Exclusively deployed by the Republic of the Sphere, the DI Morgan (Hyper Laser) was a desperate attempt to hold back the advancing Clan threat. Hastily refitted with what supplies could be spared, the 100 ton tank is equipped with a 300-rated XL Engine; and armed with a pair of RISC Hyper Lasers as well as a pair of Machine Guns. Angel ECM provides the tank with additional protection while CASE protects the crew from Hyper Laser misfires. Very few of these conversions were ever fielded and none survived to see the fall of Terra. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 3/5 Hex: 90/150 Meters. Armor: Heavy Ferro-Fibrous Structure: Structure Values A S Front 285 50 Left 205 50 Right 205 50 Rear 140 50 Turret 205 50 Total 1040 250 Quirk: Advanced Optics

content.original: Designed to complement the unique Hell's Horses TankWarrior phenotype, the Eurus is a 60-ton OmniTank designed to engage and destroy a wide array of threats. Powered by a 300-rated XL Engine that pushes the tank to speeds of 88 km/h, the Eurus is armored in 11.5 tons of Ferro-Lamellor armor; making for a fast and very tough tank. 23 tons of pod space allow for a variety of nasty configurations; making for a very versatile and deadly tank. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 5/8 Hex: 150/240 Meters. Armor: Ferro-Lamellor (C) Structure: Structure Values A S Front 220 30 Left 170 30 Right 170 30 Rear 100 30 Turret 170 30 Total 830 150 Quirk: Main Battle Tank Omni Vehicle

Powered by a 300-rated XL Engine that pushes the tank to speeds of 88 km/h, the Eurus is armored in 11.5 tons of Ferro-Lamellor armor; making for a fast and very tough tank. 23 tons of pod space allow for a variety of nasty configurations; making for a very versatile and deadly tank. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 5/8 Hex: 150/240 Meters. content.original: A light combat vehicle that first saw production in 2692 the Galleon proved to be an economical means of supporting infantry and BattleMechs. With a top speed faster than most 'Mechs, the Galleon was mobile but generally lacked protection, early models carrying only three and a half tons of armor. After the Exodus, these tracked vehicles mostly fell into the possession of the Draconis Combine and the Free Worlds League. The Galleon is often paired with the Harasser Missile Platform. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 8/12 Hex: 240/360 Meters. Armor: Hardened Structure: Structure Values A S Front 75 15 Left 55 15 Right 55 15 Rear 50 15 Turret 70 15 Total 305 75 Quirk: Protected Mechanisms

Armor: Hardened Structure: Structure Values A S Front 75 15 Left 55 15 Right 55 15 Rear 50 15 Turret 70 15 Total 305 75 Quirk: Protected Mechanisms
content.content: Легкая боевая машина, впервые появившаяся в 2692 г., Galleon показал себя экономичным средством поддержки пехоты и боевых мехов. Обладая максимальной скоростью, превышающей скорость большинства мехов, Galleon был мобилен, но не имел достаточной защиты: ранние модели несли всего три с половиной тонны брони. После Исхода эти гусеничные машины попали в основном в распоряжение Синдиката Дракона и Лиги Свободных Миров. Galleon часто используется в паре с ракетной платформой Harasser. Термоядерный: дорогой двигатель, работающий в вакууме. Передвижение: 8/12 Hex: 240/360 Meters. Броня: Hardened Структура: Structure Знач-я Б С Перед 75 15 Лево 55 15 Право 55 15 Зад 50 15 Турель 70 15 Итого 305 75 Особенность: Защищенные механизмы

content.original: Commissioned in 3042 by Imperator Marius O'Reilly, the Gladius Medium Hover Tank is a fast and simple combat vehicle. The Gladius is produced entirely on Alphard, with the exception of its single gun. The rugged design is heavily armored for a tank its size, mounting six tons of armor. The simple Internal combustion engine is cheap to produce and easy to repair and maintain. Fuel Cell: Improved vehicle engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 9/14 Hex: 270/420 Meters. Armor: Ferro-Fibrous Structure: Structure Values A S Front 170 20 Left 130 20 Right 130 20 Rear 105 20 Total 535 80 Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile

content.original: Designed with combined arms tactics in mind, the 25 ton J. Edgar (M-RE) is equipped to counter the exotic armor types in use among the DCMS. Powered by the classic 145-rated Fusion Core and covered in 5.5 tons of Heavy Ferro-Fibrous armor, the tank is armed with a Medium Re-Engineered Laser and a pair of Streak SRM-2 (I-OS). A Bloodhound Active Probe improves the Tanks scouting abilities. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 11/17 Hex: 330/510 Meters. Armor: Heavy Ferro-Fibrous Structure: Structure Values A S Front 155 15 Left 110 15 Right 110 15 Rear 80 15 Turret 130 15 Total 585 75 Quirk: Accurate Weapon - Laser

content.original: ComStar's strange fanaticism once drove the Order to erase the original name and design engineer of the JunEdgar Light Hover Tank, along with the tank's production numbers, from the historical record, because the kanji character used for her first name meant ''Purity.'' The adherents believed that this belittled Jerome Blake, the galaxy's only true embodiment of purity in their view. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 11/17 Hex: 330/510 Meters. content.original: The JES III Missile Carrier was originally built in the 3130s prior to the fall of the HPG Communication grid. The JES III was designed to be faster and better armored than its two predecessors. The vehicle's main armaments consist of four LRM-15 launchers mounted in the turret. For self-defense against regular infantry the vehicle also mounts two machine guns. The machine guns share a half ton of ammunition, while the LRM-15s can draw from a six-ton ammunition bay. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 3/5 Hex: 90/150 Meters. Armor: Armor Structure: Structure Values A S Front 200 30 Left 110 30 Right 110 30 Rear 100 30 Turret 135 30 Total 655 150 Quirk: Accurate Weapon - Missiles

For self-defense against regular infantry the vehicle also mounts two machine guns. The machine guns share a half ton of ammunition, while the Thunderbolts can draw from a six-ton ammunition bay. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 3/5 Hex: 90/150 Meters. Armor: Armor Structure: Structure Values A S Front 200 30 Left 110 30 Right 110 30 Rear 100 30 Turret 130 30 Total 650 150 Quirk: Accurate Weapon - Missiles

content.original: The Karnov UR Transport is a heavy lift VTOL which has been in service for hundreds of years. The tilt-rotor design is one of the fastest of its type in use. A reliable and hardy machine, all of the Successor State armed forces and many mercenary units employ Karnovs for supply and logistics missions. Many commercial firms also use the machine for local transportation of cargo in its sizable 6-ton bay or as a flying crane. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 8/12 Hex: 240/360 Meters. Armor: Armor Structure: Structure Values A S Front 60 15 Left 55 15 Right 55 15 Rear 55 15 Total 240 75 Quirk: Quick Off The Line

content.original: A lightly armored vehicle, the MASH Truck is not designed for combat. Equipped with a pair of Anti-Missile Systems, the MASH Truck is considered to be neutral, with most combatants going out of their way to avoid targeting or attacking the Truck. With it’s onboard array of medical equipment, the MASH can perform everything from basic triage all the way up to life saving surgery; as the situation demands. Fuel Cell: Improved vehicle engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 5/8 Hex: 150/240 Meters. Armor: Ferro-Fibrous Structure: Structure Values A S Front 60 10 Left 75 10 Right 75 10 Rear 50 10 Turret 45 10 Total 305 50 Quirk: Rugged

content.original: The newest member of the Ontos family, Grumman Amalgamated's Chemical Laser Ontos is possibly the deadliest Ontos to date. Produced in the Wolf Empire with the aid of Free Guild and Wolf Merchant Caste investments, the Ontos (Chemical) does away with the need for the heat sinks that crippled the traditional Ontos models. Exchanging the standard ICE or Fusion Engine for an XL Engine and armouring the tank in Ferro-Fibrous armor frees up the weight needed to mount 8 Large Chemical Lasers in the turret whilst retaining the standard LRM-5's. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 4/6 Hex: 120/180 Meters. Armor: Ferro-Fibrous Structure: Structure Values A S Front 350 50 Left 300 50 Right 300 50 Rear 270 50 Turret 300 50 Total 1520 250 Quirk: Accurate Weapon - Laser

content.original: Created to tap into the burgeoning market for combat vehicles in the post Blackout Inner Sphere, the 30 ton Onuris is an Omni adaption of the Anhur Assault Transport. Developed and sold by the Sea Foxes, the Onuris is covered powered by a 100-rated XL Engine augmented by a Jet Booster, giving it a top speed in excess of 160 km/h. 6 tons of Reflective armor and Clan standard CASE provide protection whilst a massive 14 tons of pod space allows for a wide variety of configurations. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 8/12 Hex: 240/360 Meters. Armor: Glazed (C) Structure: Structure Values A S Front 180 15 Left 120 15 Right 120 15 Rear 100 15 Total 535 75 Quirk: Quick Off The Line Omni Vehicle

content.original: This version of the Padilla introduced in 3134, replaces the standard Padilla weaponry with a Gauss rifle tied into a Targeting Computer. Not to be confused with the original Padilla, the Padilla Tube Artillery Tank was a Republic of the Sphere vehicle meant to fulfill a similar role. Originally designed and produced by Aldis Industries at the request of Precentor Martial Cameron St. Jamais, the Padilla Tube Artillery Tank serves as the main conventional artillery support platform used by the Republic Armed Forces. The Padilla is well-protected for a vehicle of its size. This is good as the tank's low top speed could make it an easy target for fast moving units or airstrikes. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 3/5 Hex: 90/150 Meters. Armor: Vehicle Stealth Armor Structure: Structure Values A S Front 140 30 Left 125 30 Right 125 30 Rear 95 30 Turret 110 30 Total 595 150 Quirk: Accurate Weapon - Ballistics

content.original: First appearing in 3056, the Palisade Defense Tank is a 60-ton defensive tank found throughout the wealthier parts of the Periphery. Based on an older tank design dating back to the Succession Wars, the Palisade is designed as a multi-role tank capable of engaging Mechs or Vehicles. Capable of speeds of 60 km/h, the Palisade (Streak LRM) is powered by a 240-rated Fuel Cell and carries 11.5 tons of Ferro-Fibrous armor. The main gun is an LB-10X, with a Clan SLRM-15 supporting this at longer ranges. An MG provides some limited anti-infantry capabilities and CASE mitigates crew danger should an ammo explosion happen. Fuel Cell: Improved vehicle engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 4/6 Hex: 120/180 Meters. Armor: Ferro-Fibrous Structure: Structure Values A S Front 250 30 Left 200 30 Right 200 30 Rear 190 30 Turret 200 30 Total 1040 150 Quirk: Main Battle Tank

Топливная ячейка: улучшенный двигатель, работающий в вакууме. Передвижение: 4/6 Hex: 120/180 Meters. content.original: Unveiled in 3110 the Partisan AA Vehicle, a lighter take on the original Partisan Air Defense Tank, was meant to be cheaper and faster but still be equally effective in the anti-aircraft role. Produced in 3134, this version of the Partisan AA would give the vehicle a longer reach than before, while gaining secondary weaponry which the Standard Model lacked. Gone is the standard LB-5X Class autocannons, in their place are a pair of Class 2 Hypervelocity Autocannons. Though lacking the punch of the Standard's bigger LB-5Xs, the HVAC/2s accuracy is improved by adding a Targeting Computer to the vehicle. As a secondary weapon, the vehicle is fitted with a 10-tubed Rocket Launcher in the turret. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 5/8 Hex: 150/240 Meters. Armor: Ferro-Fibrous Structure: Structure Values A S Front 120 25 Left 120 25 Right 120 25 Rear 90 25 Turret 90 25 Total 540 125 Quirk: Anti-Air Targeting

content.original: The Pilum Heavy Tank is a product of Valiant Vehicles of Johnsondale, as a new combat vehicle for the Federated Commonwealth's Armed Forces. Valiant Vehicles created the vehicle based on the success of its Striker Missile Vehicle. Initially introduced in 3058, the vehicle received criticism for its chassis, which is based on a wheeled configuration instead of the more traditional tracked option. This Dark Age variant carries a Boosted C3 system and Extended LRM launchers and its large ammunition bins are protected by CASE. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 4/6 Hex: 120/180 Meters. Armor: Heavy Ferro-Fibrous Structure: Structure Values A S Front 200 35 Left 130 35 Right 130 35 Rear 115 35 Turret 200 35 Total 775 175 Quirk: Accurate Weapon - Missiles

content.original: Originally developed by Vitesse Vehicles of Terra in 2611, the Prowler Multi-Terrain-Vehicle was the most common hostile and exotic environment military-grade exploration vehicles. The Prowler was almost unsurpassed in its niche, the design proving popular enough for Vitesse to halt production and merely license the design to manufacturers across the Inner Sphere and Periphery. While never produced in large numbers, all post–Star League era Successor State militaries maintained a number of the vehicle for combat on their most inhospitable planets. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 4/6 Hex: 120/180 Meters. Armor: Armor Structure: Environmental Sealing Values A S Front 225 30 Left 155 30 Right 155 30 Rear 125 30 Turret 175 30 Total 835 150 Quirk: Enhanced FPE

content.original: The Saladin Mk II HCV is a redesigned version of the original Third Succession War-era Saladin combat vehicle prized for its hitting power and speed. This new version of the Scarborough Manufacturers' famous line of hovercrafts would be first produced during the mid-thirty-second century. While retaining the speed of the original model, the Saladin MK II is considerably better protected by Scarborough engineers using 5.5 tons of Heavy Ferro-Fibrous Armor. The tank's primary weapon is its front-mounted Magna Flarestar Snub-Nose Particle Projection Cannon. While this has less punch than the original's heavy Autocannon, the PPC has no ammunition needs, allowing it to keep fighting longer and at greater ranges. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 10/15 Hex: 300/450 Meters. Armor: Heavy Ferro-Fibrous Structure: Structure Values A S Front 245 20 Left 120 20 Right 120 20 Rear 90 20 Total 575 80 Quirk: Nimble

content.original: The Scimitar Mk II Hover Combat Vehicle (HCV) is the successor to the original Scimitar. The vehicle has superior speed to the original Scimitar. The new version of the venerable combat vehicle began to appear at the dawn of the thirty-second century. Originally, this upgraded version of the Scimitar served as part of the Republic of the Sphere's Republic Armed Forces, being produced by Scarborough Manufacturers' Al Na'ir. Many of these vehicles were salvaged over the decades after the Jihad, and found their way into warring political militia factions in the Republic of the Sphere by 3132. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 10/15 Hex: 300/450 Meters. Armor: Heavy Ferro-Fibrous Structure: Structure Values A S Front 175 20 Left 105 20 Right 105 20 Rear 75 20 Turret 115 20 Total 575 100 Quirk: Rugged

content.original: Initially produced by the Quikscell Company in 2807, the Scorpion Light Tank is famously easy to repair, available in numbers, and best of all, cheap. Only marginally effective on it's merits, the Scorpion has proven effective in mass numbers. Swarms of Scorpions, easily procured due to their low cost, are an often-encountered danger on poorer worlds. The vehicle is produced on many planets within the Inner Sphere. Many local variations, upgrades, and downgrades as required by circumstance are in use. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 4/6 Hex: 120/180 Meters. Armor: Armor Structure: Structure Values A S Front 100 15 Left 85 15 Right 85 15 Rear 80 15 Turret 100 15 Total 450 75 Quirk: Protected Mechanisms

content.original: The SM Tank Destroyer was designed as a speedy infighter by scientists from Clan Nova Cat. The machine is a cheap and effective combat vehicle. The vehicle has unique 'glass' dual cockpits on the front of the vehicle that are functionally identical while mounting a smaller anti-infantry turret just behind its left side cockpit. The vehicle's unique split cockpit design allows the cockpit modules to eject from the vehicle. Due to its appearance, the SM1 was dubbed the 'Suicide Machine' by its first pilots because they felt overexposed with the tank's all ferro-glass cockpit. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 9/14 Hex: 270/420 Meters. Armor: Ballistic Reinforced Structure: Structure Values A S Front 120 25 Left 100 25 Right 100 25 Rear 75 25 Turret 100 25 Total 495 125 Quirk: Stable Weapons Omni Vehicle

content.original: Released in 3149, the Sturmfeur (Fuel Cell) is an updated copy of the original 3018 tank. Swapping to a 340 Fuel Cell allowed designers to increase the tanks speed to 64 km/h and still haul around the same level of armor protection; though the updated model makes the switch to Heavy Ferro-Fibrous with CASE'd ammunition magazines. The original LRM-20's are swapped for ClanTech versions with Artemis IV FCS installed though the designers chose to keep the original model machine guns. Fuel Cell: Improved vehicle engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 4/6 Hex: 120/180 Meters. Armor: Heavy Ferro-Fibrous Structure: Structure Values A S Front 350 45 Left 350 45 Right 350 45 Rear 275 45 Turret 330 45 Total 1655 225 Quirk: Accurate Weapon - Missiles

content.original: Based on the Civil War era Heavy Gauss equipped Sturmfeur, the Sturmfeur (Assault) upgrades the 255 Fusion Engine to a L255 Light Engine. Designers used the free tonnage to add CASE and Guardian ECM followed by an upgrade to Heavy Ferro-Fibrous armor. The resultant free weight was used to upgrade the Heavy Gauss Rifle to an Improved model and add a ClanTech LRM-20 to the front hull. The ER Medium Laser and LRM-10 are also replaced with ClanTech models. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 3/5 Hex: 90/150 Meters. content.original: Named for a Roman military formation, the Testudo siege tank was constructed as an infantry support unit for the Marian Hegemony in 3131. Put into service after the Hegemony's infantry unrest became an issue, the Testudo was created as a dual role Combat Vehicle. The design provides combat units with artillery fire support while being able to shift to the frontlines and aid infantry forces with its autocannon and machine guns. Fuel Cell: Improved vehicle engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 3/5 Hex: 90/150 Meters. content.original: The Winston Combat Vehicle was a Republic of the Sphere frontline combat vehicle that began production in 3085. A late Dark Age variant, introduced in 3133, this variant is powered by an XXL Fusion Engine and is armed with a pair of Large Re-Engineered Lasers and a pair of Clan-spec LRM-15s sharing six tons of ammo. Front-mounted AMS adds to the tank's defenses. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 3/5 Hex: 90/150 Meters. content.original:
The modernized ALB-6U combines solid all-range firepower with impressive speed for its size, a feat accomplished by relying on a fragile composite structure and an extra-light gyro. It often serves as a bodyguard in Marik heavy fire-support lances, where the grand bird's hollow bones are less of a liability. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Long Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.17

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

content.original:
Clan Wolf's migration to the Wolf Empire abandoned the only manufacturing site for the capable Night Wolf in their former occupation zone. A crash retooling of the Washburn factory produced the Albatross C as a replacement, but it proved a pale imitation of the rapidly dwindling original. Plans to mass-produce the derisively dubbed 'Sooty Albatross' were shelved until Star Colonel Othar’s desperate rearmament of the Wolf Empire, and even then, assignment to this "failed" model was thought to be an ill omen. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Long Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.17

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

content.original: The primary model carries all of its weapons in the torso, while the other variants have their weapons in the head and arms. It is equipped with twenty and a half tons of Hardened Armor for better protection and a Supercharger to increase the speed of the 'Mech. The main long-range weapon is an ER PPC with a PPC Capacitor in the right torso for fighting off incoming 'Mechs intending to carry out a DFA attack, backed up by a rotary AC/5 in the left torso and a large pulse laser in the center torso. Finally, the 'Mech carries two Streak SRM-6s in the right torso for engaging targets at close range. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.24

content.original: This variant strips out all armaments for different weapons and adds MASC to increase its mobility. The right torso carries a Streak LRM-20 with two tons of ammo, along with an Improved Heavy Large Laser. The PPC is replaced by two AP gauss rifles with one ton of ammo between them. Finally, a trio of ER Medium Lasers are carried, one in in each arm and one in the head, and both the lasers and ammo are protected by CASE II. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.24

content.original: This Mixed Tech variant focuses on combating DFA tactics. Spikes are added along with nine and a half additional tons of Hardened Armor to better protect the Amarok from 'Mechs attempting to conduct such an attack. The PPC is replaced with an LRM 20 with Artemis V and the RAC is replaced with a Hyper-Assault Gauss Rifle 20, both with two tons of ammo and protected by CASE II. Seven small pulse lasers are added, three in each arm and one in the center torso, intended for inflicting disruptive damage on oncoming enemies. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.24

Spikes are added along with nine and a half additional tons of Hardened Armor to better protect the Amarok from 'Mechs attempting to conduct such an attack. The PPC is replaced with an LRM 20 with Artemis V and the RAC is replaced with a Hyper-Assault Gauss Rifle 20, both with two tons of ammo and protected by CASE II. Seven small pulse lasers are added, three in each arm and one in the center torso, intended for inflicting disruptive damage on oncoming enemies. Особенность: Боевые кулаки Множитель стоимости высадки: 1.24

content.original: The Arion, developed by Clan Hell's Horses, is a versatile hybrid combat unit designed for both BattleMech and tank configurations. Equipped with an ER Large Laser and two SRM-4 launchers, the Arion is capable of delivering devastating firepower at medium to long ranges. With a top speed of 97 km/h, it can rapidly traverse the battlefield and reposition as needed. The Arion's conversion capability allows it to operate as either a fast, heavily armed BattleMech or a heavily armored tank with a low profile, depending on the mission's needs. In BattleMech mode, the Arion is capable of agile and dynamic movements, thanks to its quadrupedal design. When converted to a tank, the Arion provides an armored, low-profile platform with a powerful punch. Despite its versatility, the Arion is not as heavily armored as traditional BattleMechs, and its conversion process takes time and resources, making it less effective in rapidly changing combat situations. Nevertheless, its ability to perform in multiple roles makes it a valuable asset in a wide range of missions. Quirk: QuadVee Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.06

content.original: The Draconis Combine designed AS8-K brings the Atlas up to latest technological changes, with a large focus on durability. Using 26 tons of state of the art Ballistic-Reinforced armor and Heavy Duty Gyro, combined with the fact both side torsos mount a C.A.S.E. II, the 'Mech is able to take quite the pounding before it starts failing. To free the space needed a 300 XL engine is used, which allows it to still mount the impressive weaponry of two ER Large Lasers, a Streak SRM-6 launcher, a MML-5 launcher, a Gauss Rifle and two ER Medium Lasers. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18

content.original: The AS8-KE is the export version of the AS8-K, which uses a Standard engine as Draconis Combine were not keen on on exporting the Extra Light engine equipped Assault 'Mechs to its neighbors and also as a means of reducing the price. To reduce the weight all the secondary weaponry was removed, leaving only the ER Large Lasers, MML-5 launcher and the Gauss Rifle. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18

content.original: With the introduction of the AS8-S program, which combined the Atlas and Atlas II production lines, Defiance Industries suddenly had a massive stockpile of superfluous Atlas components. Their solution was to use off-the-shelf components, in a limited-run variant that combined the Atlas II with the engine of the AS7-K2. This AS7-DK-H model proved so successful that it remains in production. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18

content.original:
The -12S builds upon the endo-steel chassis of prior models, upgrading it with a home-built Clan-grade engine and lasers. The weight savings enabled Defiance’s engineers to follow the weaponry layout of the -3S. Armor levels match the toughest Banshees, creating a very strong and fast assault ’Mech, albeit one with a challenging heat curve. Alpha-striking will shut the ’Mech down, so MechWarriors are advised to use either the main or secondary weapons, but not both at once. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.17

content.original: A typical IIC Version, the BL-IIC-KNT is rebuilt to be updated with Clan technology. Combining several types of weapons, its total weaponary is quite impressive considering its size. The largest weapon is its LBX AC/10, which is the only ballistic weapon except for two AMS for self-protection. The 'Mech carries three different type of missile launchers, one LRM-15, one SRM-6 and two Stream SRM-2. The remaining weapons are all energy based, one ER PPC and five lasers of various types. The heavy armament is only possible by using a 300 XL engine, Endo Steel chassis and Ferro-Fibrous armor. An Active Probe is mounted in the Center Torso. Quirk: Stable Weapons Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

content.original: The Alternate Configuration A of the Boreas is a unique configuration with a singular weapon: the Class-20 Hyper-Assault Gauss Rifle, which packs a punch with its high-velocity ammunition. Although this configuration lacks variety in its weaponry, it makes up for it with its raw firepower. With two tons of ammunition, the A can dish out damage to enemy targets with its Gauss Rifle without the need for additional weapons. Its simplicity allows for a straightforward and devastating attack on the battlefield, making it a valuable asset in any combat situation. Quirk: QuadVee Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

content.original: The Alternate Configuration B of the Boreas Prime was designed to provide long-range fire support for Clan Hell's Horses. It features a 20-tubed Streak LRM launcher with two tons of ammunition, allowing it to rain down accurate and devastating missile salvos on enemy targets from afar. The B configuration sacrifices some of the Prime's close-range combat capabilities in exchange for the enhanced firepower at range, making it an ideal choice for defensive or supporting roles in battle. Its armor has also been slightly modified to better withstand indirect fire and other long-range threats. Quirk: QuadVee Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

content.original: The Alternate Configuration C of the Boreas Prime, developed by Clan Hell's Horses, is a versatile loadout designed for multi-purpose combat situations. The Mech can engage from a long range with its advanced Tactical Missile System-12 (ATM-12) launcher or engage in closer combat with the missile launcher in combination with its two Extended Range Medium Lasers (ER Medium Lasers). The Mech carries up to three tons of ammunition to ensure a sustained offensive. This configuration offers a potent mix of precision, speed, and durability. It is perfect for various missions ranging from anti-infantry to anti-Mech operations. With a top speed of 64 km/h, the Boreas Prime configuration C is a reliable and versatile combat unit. Quirk: QuadVee Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

content.original: The Boreas Prime's D configuration is optimized for devastating energy output. With a pair of Heavy Large Lasers mounted on either side of its torso, this configuration can deliver overwhelming firepower at medium to long range. However, this increase in firepower comes at a cost, as the heat buildup from firing both lasers simultaneously can quickly overtax the mech's heat management systems. To mitigate this, four additional Laser Heat Sinks are added to the configuration, allowing the Boreas to maintain its firepower for longer periods of time before needing to cool down. This configuration is ideal for situations where overwhelming firepower is necessary, but care must be taken to avoid overheating the mech. Quirk: QuadVee Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

content.original: The Boreas Prime is an OmniMech and QuadVee hybrid designed and produced by Clan Hell's Horses. Armed with an ER PPC, Medium Pulse Laser, and Streak SRM-6, it is well-suited for mid-to-long range combat engagements. With a top speed of 64 km/h, it is capable of quickly maneuvering around the battlefield. Its OmniMech design allows for modular customization, making it a versatile platform for any mission. It is a potent combatant in the hands of a skilled pilot. Its QuadVee hybrid design provides additional stability and mobility, making it suitable for rough terrain. Quirk: QuadVee Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

content.original: Reengineered from the -5D design before it reached production maturity, Johnston Industries created the -5R and immediately put the highly durable chassis into production. Reduced dependency on expensive imported components keeps the new Caesar low-cost. The CES-5R can hang in a fight longer than most 'Mechs its size, thanks to hardened armor and a mostly energy-based arsenal. Its largest flaw remains the limited maneuverability, leaving the 'Mech vulnerable against more agile foes. Quirk: Hyper-Extending Actuators Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

The Catapult's most notable weapons are its two TSEMP Cannons mounted in the side torsos, which allow it to potentially disable an enemy 'Mech. The Catapult II retains the original's movement, jump capabilities and has a half ton more armor protection than its predecessor. Introduced a year after the base model in 3136, the advanced L7L is designed as a more conventional Capellan design with enhanced armor. The 'Mech trades in all its base weaponry for two Plasma Rifles mounted in each of the side torsos, and two 9-tube Multi-Missile Launchers. The design's most noted feature is its Heat-Dissipating Armor, which offers the variant greater resistance to heat related attacks. Quirk: Accurate Weapon - Missiles Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

content.original:
The Coyotl has the honor of being the first OmniMech. Developed by Clan Coyote with some help from Clan Sea Fox, the Coyotl was first fielded in 2854. By using an XL Engine and Endo Steel chassis, the scientists were able to create a medium 'Mech that could carry a great deal of equipment. In addition, the high ground speed of the Coyotl allowed it to rush from one area of a battlefield to another, providing support for its teammates. The C configuration carries an ATM-6 in the left arm, an ER Large Laser in the right arm, and a Plasma Cannon in the right torso. The missile launcher and plasma cannon each have two tons of ammo. Additional protection is provided by an ECM Suite to jam enemy C3 networks. Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.03

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

content.original:

By using an XL Engine and Endo Steel chassis, the scientists were able to create a medium 'Mech that could carry a great deal of equipment. In addition, the high ground speed of the Coyotl allowed it to rush from one area of a battlefield to another, providing support for its teammates. The D features an Improved Heavy Large Laser and AP Gauss Rifle tied into a Targeting Computer. To rapidly engage and disengage threats, a Supercharger on the engine allows the 'Mech to sprint at speeds of up to 150 km/h. Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.03

content.original: Built on a composite chassis and equipped with a small cockpit, XL gyro, and XXL engine, the Cricket carries a pair of light PPCs tied into an advanced targeting computer to allow accurate long-ranged fire. The smaller, lighter equipment allows the Cricket to carry nine tons of ballistic reinforced armor. This makes it resistant to the weapons often employed by the AFFS. The downside to these advanced systems is increased maintenance times; The Cricket has developed a reputation as a 'hangar queen'. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99

content.original:
The Crucible is designed to inflict the largest amount of damage in the fastest amount of time, to achieve this it carries a Gauss Rifle in each arm and side torso together with 8 tons of ammunition. Though the twelve double heat sinks are more than enough for the Gauss Rifles, the additional heat sinks allow the Crucible pilot to ignore heat from plasma weapons and Inferno rounds. A Micro Pulse Laser is also fitted for anti-infantry operations. Fifteen tons of standard armor covers the chassis. To free room and weight for this equipment the Crucible uses an 300-rated XL Engine and Endo Steel chassis, as a result the Crucible can reach 54 km/h max speed and has 90 meter jump range. Quirk: Protected Actuators Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.24

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

Each arm mounts a pair of medium re-engineered lasers and an MML-3. Another MML-3 is mounted in each hip. An anti-missile system is mounted in the head. Fifteen double heat sinks are fitted and to make room for the weapons engineers used an endo steel chassis and compact gyro. content.original: The Cyllaros has a unique design that combines the mobility and versatility of a vehicle with the firepower and durability of a BattleMech. It has four legs that can be retracted for stability movement on flat terrain, and extended for greater stability and maneuverability on rough terrain. The Cyllaros is armed with an array of energy and ballistic weapons, making it a formidable opponent on the battlefield. Despite initial resistance, the Cyllaros has proven to be a successful combat unit, and has been used in various conflicts. Quirk: QuadVee Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.11

content.original:
After more than three years of reverse-engineering the Federated Suns' work, the Combine is rolling out its first ever variant of the Dervish. Sporting some of the planned weaponry from the intended variant, the DV-11DK pairs Combine built ClanTech missile launchers with the Suns' hitherto proprietary re-engineered lasers to devastating effect, while maintaining its traditional long-range punch. Quirk: Hyper-Extending Actuators Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

content.original:
After the DVS-10 was met quite unfavourably by the AFFS, Corean fell under severe pressure to bring back the original Devastator and its powerful punch. However, they instead reworked the assault 'Mech once more. The resulting DVS-11 is the compromise no one knew they needed. Nearly as fast as the -10, the return of the classic weaponry—dual Gauss rifles and a PPC—allows this Devastator to tangle with the toughest of Atlases or Stalkers. It is regarded as a premier line-breaker, and its swift sales have prompted Norse-Storm executives to approach Corean for a licensing agreement. Quirk: Hyper-Extending Actuators Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

content.original:
This Clan Hell's Horses configuration was introduced in 3149. Each arm carries a HAG 20, two ER Medium Lasers, and two Medium Pulse Lasers. For long range support a Streak LRM-10 is carried in the left torso. To increase speed, an engine Supercharger is fitted as well. A Light Active Probe detects hidden foes. Five extra double heat sinks are carried as well. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Long Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.19

content.original:
The Dominator is built with 10.5 tons of Ferro-Fibrous Armor and Endo Steel Internal Structure, 18 double heat sinks, a Supercharger, and enough Jump Jets for 150 meter jump range. The Dominator is equipped with a targeting computer to help control the weapons consisting of an ER Large Laser, an ER PPC and a Streak SRM-6 launcher. For close quarters combat it also carries a head mounted small laser and battle fists. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

content.original:
The ER-PPC is changed out for a second extended range large laser. The supercharger is removed, as is the streak SRM. Replacing the streak SRM is an LRM-20 with an Artemis V FCS. The missile rack is supplied with two tons of ammunition. The 'Mech's close range firepower is adjusted with an ER Medium Laser, while all weapons are still tied into a less sizeable Targeting Computer. This refit was successful enough to be adopted as a new factory model. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

content.original: The Doom Courser mounts 12 ton of Ferro-Fibrous armor on a Endo Composite chassis frame. A 280-rated fusion engine core means the 'Mech's biggest weakness, like many other Quads, is its lack of speed and manueverability. The Alpha loadout of the Doom Courser switches from the single Artemis IV LRM-20 launcher to two turret mounted ATM-12 launchers, and a Large Pulse Laser replaces the ER PPC. Since the Gauss Rifle also had to be removed, this configuration does not have the same direct damage profile, but can do considerable damage indirectly over time. Quirk: Quad Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.11

content.original:
The ENF-5R is relatively low-tech compared to the Enforcer III. It can be constructed quickly and in large numbers by the reborn Kallon Industries lines following the loss of New Avalon. The LB 10-X is easily produced, while the large reengineered laser counters some of the newer armors of modern battlefields. Although slower than the Enforcer III, its light engine is more durable, and with the addition of CASE II the -5R can stay in the field longer. As with earlier models, the size of the head-mounted sensor pod varies, depending on which targeting system is installed. Quirk: Improved Cooling Jacket - AC Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

content.original:
Similar to the Prime, the Executioner T uses some newer technologies. Two ER Large Pulse Lasers are mounted on the right forearm giving the T an accurate and powerful long range punch. The twin Machine Guns of the Prime still reside in the right torso with their single ton of ammo, but now also with an ECM Suite. An LB 10-X Autocannon replaces the Gauss Rifle in the left arm. Its two tons of ammo are located in the left torso. Quirk: Intimidating Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18

content.original: A Dark Age variant first produced in 3148, the Exterminator EXT-7X is used by the Republic of the Sphere for special operations work. Built around a 325-rated XXL Engine, it is slower then most other Exterminator models; though a Supercharger and Stealth Armor help to alleviate this issue. An MRM-10 and 4 Medium VSPLs make up the Mechs armament with a Laser AMS providing additional protection against missiles. Quirk: Nimble Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

content.original:
Originating after the 17th battle of Hesperus II, the Fafnir II is the designation given to a limited production run of custom Fafnir's created with battlefield salvage. Built by Defiance Industries, the 100 ton Fafnir II FNR2-5-A is powered by a 300-rated Light Engine and protected by 21 tons of Ferro-Lamellor armor. A pair of HAG/30's form the primary armament, with 4 ER Medium Lasers for close range combat. A Targeting Computer improves the Mechs accuracy. Quirk: Stable Weapons Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

content.original:
In most regards, the 5A is an updated version of prior Firefly variants, incorporating modern technologies to make it a significantly more powerful 'Mech. The weaponry is mildly upgraded from the original armament. The FFL-5A's most notable improvements are however its increased engine size and the additional functionality of its partial wings - mostly cosmetic in prior models. This addressed one of the chief criticisms of the Firefly: poor mobility for a light 'Mech. The FFL-5A Firefly has reclaimed its status as one of the Dragoons' primary light combat units, which will undoubtedly make it an attractive purchase for other mercenary commands Quirk: Improved Sensors Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

content.original:
Defiance Industries's new Firestarter, the FS9-N, uses a mix of in-house Clan-grade XL engines and ER lasers, and centerpiece Plasma Cannon. Classic styling combined with greater combat impact made this attractive to both House and mercenary markets. The use of the designation 'Mirage II' put Defiance into a legal case with Coventry Metal Works, since Coventry had originally dubbed the -M model the 'Mirage' and therefore took great offense of the nickname of the FS9-N. Quirk: Ubiquitous Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.98

content.original:
The Firestorm focuses on anti-infantry and anti-vehicle combat. Similar to the Shadow Cat, the Firestorm uses a single main weapon supported by several smaller ones. The right arm carries an Inner Sphere-produced plasma rifle fed by two tons of ammunition, while a plasma cannon mounted in the right torso and fed by one ton of ammunition provides additional power. Supporting these weapons are a flamer, micro pulse laser, and ER medium laser mounted in the left arm. Built on an endo-steel skeleton, the Firestorm uses a 250-rated extralight engine to reach a speed of 86 km/h. A MASC system mounted in the left torso allows it to sprint at speeds of 108 km/h. Seven improved jump jets let the 'Mech cover 210 meters in a jump. Protection is provided by nine tons of ferro-fibrous armor. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Upper

content.original: Powered by a 200-rated XL Engine and mounting MASC, the 20 ton Fire Moth is one of the fastest Mechs ever created. Designed for scouting and as an Elemental transport, the Fire Moth entered production in 2874. A combination of Ferro-Fibrous and Endo Steel give the Fire Moth 7.5 tons of Pod Space. The Fire Moth I is armed with an ER Large Laser, an Improved Heavy Small Laser and an LRM-5. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.98

The Fujin was designed to face the Combine's traditional enemy: the Federated Suns. The Fujin's speed and ER PPC allow it to track and destroy most enemy targets at long range as it moves into close combat. Its shell of ballistic-reinforced armor provides additional protection against Davion autocannons and missile weapons, allowing it to bring its array of SRM launchers and ER medium lasers to bear Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

content.original:
Designed as a close combat skirmisher the Gargoyle J also has impressive maneuverability. Seven torso mounted Improved Jump Jets give the 'Mech a 210 meter jump range. This, along with its 86 km/h top speed, allows the 'Mech to easily bring its close range laser batteries into range. The heavy firepower of four Improved Heavy Medium Lasers fires from the right arm, while a brace of seven ER Small Lasers fires from the left. These weapons allow the J to eviscerate a foe’s armor up close, but leaves the J helpless at longer ranges and forces it to rely on its maneuverability to avoid enemy fire as it closes. Quirk: Stable Weapons Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

content.original:
Following on the heels of the Jade Falcon’s adoption of physical attacks, the Gargoyle K represents a paradigm shift in tactics of other Clans. Mounting a six ton Hatchet in its right arm the Gargoyle K is the first Clan 'Mech so equipped. Adding to the danger of the hatchet is a Supercharger that allows the K to run at over 100 km/h, a staggering speed for an assault 'Mech. Focused solely on short range destruction, the K's other weapons are for use up close. Each of the 'Mech’s torsos comes equipped with a Streak SRM-4 launcher. All three launchers are fed by a single ton of ammo in the CASE II protected left torso. Four Improved Heavy Medium Lasers reside in the left arm. To ensure no targets can hide from the K an Active Probe is housed in the right torso. Quirk: Stable Weapons Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

content.original: Developed as a complement to the Griffin in the later years of the Jihad, the Ghost is a medium strike 'Mech that saw considerable use in the years after the formation of the Republic of the Sphere. Developed by the Lyran Commonwealth and elements of the former Free Worlds League the Ghost carries an extensive array of electronic warfare equipment into combat. A Beagle Active Probe allows the Ghost to find enemy units, while Stealth Armor and a Guardian ECM Suite allows the 'Mech to live up to its name. With excellent land speed and formidable medium-range weaponry, the Ghost is ideal for hunter-killer and heavy raiding missions, especially when paired with Griffins.Another variant introduced in 3133 removes the SRM-6 rack from the standard Dark Age Ghost and replaces it with a Chainsaw to minimize logistical needs, or potentially to disguise it as an IndustrialMech. Quirk: Improved Sensors Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.06

With excellent land speed and formidable medium-range weaponry, the Ghost is ideal for hunter-killer and heavy raiding missions, especially when paired with Griffins.Another variant introduced in 3133 removes the SRM-6 rack from the standard Dark Age Ghost and replaces it with a Chainsaw to minimize logistical needs, or potentially to disguise it as an IndustrialMech. Особенность: Улучшенные сенсоры Множитель стоимости высадки: 1.06

content.original:
Introduced by the Wolf Empire, this configuration fits an XL engine and Supercharger to the standard chassis. In place of the standard Gauss Rifles, each arm carries a HAG 20 which share seven tons of ammunition. Three ER Small Lasers are placed in the right torso. All these weapons are tied into a Targeting Computer. This design is primarily used for anti-aircraft work. Quirk: Anti-Air Targeting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

content.original: A variant of the -7R from Brigadier Corporation, focused on medium-range combat, much like Osaka's offering. A competitor to Corean's own Phoenix Goliaths, the GOL-7C added insult to injury by mimicking Corean's long-gone Sirocco with its Streak SRMs and Ultra AC/10. This dedicated brawler is often deployed alongside the more traditional -7R as an anti-infantry escort. Quirk: Quad Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

content.original: The complex actuator design and the lack of credible defensive weaponry leaves the Goliath open to close-range attacks and battle armor swarms. Osaka Heavy Metrics’ recently introduced GOL-7K has a deadly counter to such threats: M-pods concealed in the center torso and in each leg. These defenses are hidden behind blow-away panels designed to resemble maintenance hatches, providing an unwelcome surprise for anyone who gets too close. With a focus on mediumrange combat, this Goliath variant is part of their expansion to add a true BattleMech to their stable of combat support quad IndustrialMechs. How and when Osaka acquired the plans is unknown, but espionage is suspected. Quirk: Quad Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

content.original: An Advanced Clan Tech conversion of the GOL-6M created by Clan Wolf in 3143. The weapons are converted to Clan versions while retaining the BattleMech Quad Turret. The Quad Turret houses a Clan Gauss Rifle, teamed with Clan ER Large Laser and Micro Pulse Laser. A single ATM 9 with two tons of ammo, and a single Clan ER Medium Laser in the head round out the 'Mechs offensive weaponry. On each leg the 'Mech has a B-Pod, and CASE II is mounted in of the 'Mech's legs. The hull of the 'Mech is protected by fourteen and a half tons of Inner Sphere armor. Quirk: Quad Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

content.original: The Götterdämmerung is a Heavy class BattleMech first fielded by the Lyran Commonwealth in 3138, the 'Mech's German name translates to twilight of the gods or ragnarök. The Götterdämmerung's durability is due in part of layers of Heavy Ferro-Fibrous Armor, while Blackstone would move the cockpit of the 'Mech to the torso. The Torso-Mounted Cockpit's ejection system is highly complex, making escape from the Götterdämmerung difficult under certain circumstances. MechWarriors piloting the 'Mech need also be wary of losing their side torsos, due to the split placement of their life support systems. Quirk: Stable Weapons Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09
