content.original: Scout & Skirmisher
content.prevOriginal: Scout & Skirmisher
content.content: Разведчик-стрелок

content.original: First introduced by the Terran Hegemony in 2568, the Phoenix Hawk was one of the most famous BattleMechs in the Inner Sphere. The 'Mech began life when Orguss Industries realized that it could reinforce the Stinger chassis to create a larger version, one with the same speed and maneuverability as the Stinger but with superior armor, firepower, and electronics. Originally a staple of the SLDF, Phoenix Hawks remained common within the armies of the Successor States after the fall of the Star League. At first Phoenix Hawks were grouped together to form powerful recon lances, but as they started reaching their various deployments, their full potential as command 'Mechs was discovered and many were reassigned to instead lead units of smaller recon 'Mechs.

content.original: Another Earthwerks-FWL developed model, this variant was produced on Keystone.[63] An Inner Sphere XL engine and endo steel chassis were fitted with multiple Clan-spec systems. Like the traditional Phoenix Hawk, this version carries a Clan medium pulse laser and AP Gauss rifle in each arm. The right arm also carries a Clan large pulse laser. All these weapons are tied into a Clan-built targeting computer. What makes this version stand out is the supercharger which allows the 'Mech to reach 120 km/h Quirk: Improved Communications Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.03

content.original:
This model is produced by both Oriente Weapon Works and Kallon Industries using the latest innovations to move the Rifleman towards a more prominent role again. Compared to its brother design, the RFL-7N2, the RFL-7N focuses more on direct energy weapons over ballistics. This model is produced by both Oriente Weapon Works and Kallon Industries, although not in as great numbers as the -7N2. Quirk: Anti-Air Targeting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.08

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

content.original:
The Rifleman C 3 are completely constructed from scratch, unlike the Rifleman C retrofit of the RFL-3N, which pair integrated cutting-edge technology with classic styling. With its dual Ultra AC/5 and twin Extended-Range Large Lasers main armament, the C 3 is perfect for garrisoning duties. The combination of Ferro-Fibrous armor with CASE II and Endo Steel structure also allows adding two Extended-Range Medium Lasers for close range protection and a total of 14 heatsinks. Quirk: Anti-Air Targeting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

content.original: Many MechWarriors assigned a Rime Otter have outright demanded Sea Fox-built powerhouses like a Mad Dog Mk IV or a WarBear-designed Stormwolf instead. On the other hand, some pilots believe a warrior should work for a kill rather than simply overwhelm foes with firepower. I am one of the latter.

content.original:
Building off lessons learned from the Grizzly, the Rime Otter is intended to fill the role of a heavy medium fire support 'Mech for the Rasalhague Dominion going forward. The Rime Otter is fast enough to keep up with a Fire Moth and rugged enough to stand beside a Mastodon. Unfortunately, this comes at the cost of only having the the pod space of a 45-ton 'Mech. The Prime configuration mounts two Large Pulse Lasers and an Artemis V-enabled LRM10 launcher, carried to battle by a 275 XL engine. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.06

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

content.original:
Still a fearsome and powerful design, where the original Annihilator-1A carries a bevy of powerful autocannons, the -1E instead opts for an all-energy weapon loadout. Four Particle Projection Cannons give the Annihilator-1E a brutal and incredibly powerful punch while the Medium Lasers from the -1A are carried over for in-close protection while increasing the armor protection somewhat to mitigate enemy return fire. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.24

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

content.original:
The ASN-109 retains the same extra-light engine and armor as its similar variants, compensating structural fragility with speed and stealth to make it very difficult to hit. The harasser and scout hunter's armament returns to a classic layout that allows it to snipe effectively, while the improved one-shot SRM rack generally contains alternate payloads to cover retreats. Acknowledging that the cockpit issues that long plagued the Assassin could never be properly eliminated, a new small unit was installed. This allowed for a more efficient layout and weight savings over the original Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.02

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

content.original:
Impressive speed, stealth systems, and an ECM package make the FLE-21 a difficult target. Its energy arsenal makes it a premier behind-the-lines raider - hard to spot and nigh-impossible to catch. Fleas often constitute the first wave of Capellan advances, scouting ahead of the main body for enemy positions and striking at key infrastructure, then drawing enemy forces into pre-planned ambushes. Quirk: Improved Lifesupport Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.97

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

content.original:
After Clan Hell's Horses forces' invaded the Rasalhague Dominion during Operation Noyan in 3147, the Mastodon was designed and signified a large change from their previous reliance on a mix of Executioner variants as the mainstay of their army. The Mastodon's performance after its introduction makes it inevitable that it will be at the forefront of many campaigns to come. The heavily reinforced structure resists both weapons fire and the standard wear and tear that accompanies most campaigns. The A configuration combines an Artemis IV enabled LRM-15 launcher with three Large Pulse Lasers and a Gauss Rifle. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

content.original: Developed in the Dark Age by Earthwerks-FWL on Calloway VI, this version keeps the typical ground speed of 96 km/h but uses eight improved jump jets to cover 240 meters at a time. The weaponry consists of a medium laser and light machine gun in each arm, but the main striking power comes from a right arm–mounted large X-Pulse laser. The center torso carries a half ton of light machine gun ammunition in a CASE II–protected bay. Quirk: Improved Communications Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.03

content.original: Another Earthwerks-FWL developed model, this variant was produced on Keystone.[63] An Inner Sphere XL engine and endo steel chassis were fitted with multiple Clan-spec systems. Like the traditional Phoenix Hawk, this version carries a Clan medium pulse laser and AP Gauss rifle in each arm. The right arm also carries a Clan large pulse laser. All these weapons are tied into a Clan-built targeting computer. What makes this version stand out is the supercharger which allows the 'Mech to reach 120 km/h Quirk: Improved Communications Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.03

content.original:
This model is produced by both Oriente Weapon Works and Kallon Industries using the latest innovations to move the Rifleman towards a more prominent role again. Compared to its brother design, the RFL-7N2, the RFL-7N focuses more on direct energy weapons over ballistics. This model is produced by both Oriente Weapon Works and Kallon Industries, although not in as great numbers as the -7N2. Quirk: Anti-Air Targeting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.08

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

content.original:
The Rifleman C 3 are completely constructed from scratch, unlike the Rifleman C retrofit of the RFL-3N, which pair integrated cutting-edge technology with classic styling. With its dual Ultra AC/5 and twin Extended-Range Large Lasers main armament, the C 3 is perfect for garrisoning duties. The combination of Ferro-Fibrous armor with CASE II and Endo Steel structure also allows adding two Extended-Range Medium Lasers for close range protection and a total of 14 heatsinks. Quirk: Anti-Air Targeting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

content.original:
Building off lessons learned from the Grizzly, the Rime Otter is intended to fill the role of a heavy medium fire support 'Mech for the Rasalhague Dominion going forward. The Rime Otter is fast enough to keep up with a Fire Moth and rugged enough to stand beside a Mastodon. Unfortunately, this comes at the cost of only having the the pod space of a 45-ton 'Mech. The Prime configuration mounts two Large Pulse Lasers and an Artemis V-enabled LRM10 launcher, carried to battle by a 275 XL engine. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.06

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

content.original: A proposed Dark Age overhaul of the classic Phoenix Hawk, the PHX-99 is a unique take on the standard Phoenix Hawk. Emphasising armor over mobility, the PHX-99 is coated in Hardened Armor, reinforced by a Heavy Duty Gyro and Modular Armor. To fit this in, the engine has been downgraded to a 50-rated Fusion Core, forcing the Mech to rely on a pair of Improved Jump Jets for mobility. Armed with a Large X-Pulse Laser, a pair of ER Medium Lasers and a pair of ER Small Lasers, the PHX-99 is considered a failed prototype for a reason. Quirk: Improved Communications Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.03

content.original: Boss, this thing has as much armor as an assault mech and it ain't no pirate junkhead doing it either, it was purposely designed like this for some reason. Sure, it's heavily armored but it's gonna need it because it's gonna be outpaced by even dismounted infantry..at a walk.

content.original: Debuting in 3142 on the King of the Mountain, Jasmine is a customized PXH-7K variant piloted by Team Genie's Lindsey Larkin in the 3146 Royal Fantasy Tournament. Mounting standard jump jets to save weight, Jasmine adds a PPC capacitor to the snub-nose PPC in its right arm, supported by a right torso-mounted RL-10 and twin ER medium laser in the left arm. While boasting an extra-half ton of armor, the majority of the extra weight reclaimed from removing the 7K's improved jump jets allows Jasmine to amount an Angel ECM suite and a Drone Command Console that its pilot uses to command a companion Celerity drone dubbed Rajah in the arenas. Quirk: Improved Communications Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

content.original: First introduced by the Terran Hegemony in 2568, the Phoenix Hawk was one of the most famous BattleMechs in the Inner Sphere. The 'Mech began life when Orguss Industries realized that it could reinforce the Stinger chassis to create a larger version, one with the same speed and maneuverability as the Stinger but with superior armor, firepower, and electronics. Originally a staple of the SLDF, Phoenix Hawks remained common within the armies of the Successor States after the fall of the Star League. At first Phoenix Hawks were grouped together to form powerful recon lances, but as they started reaching their various deployments, their full potential as command 'Mechs was discovered and many were reassigned to instead lead units of smaller recon 'Mechs.

content.original:
Constructed using Inner Sphere technologies, the 'Mech design was envisioned with economics in mind. The Avalanche is powered by a 250-rated fusion engine, giving it a modest maximum speed of 86 km/h, while its hull is protected by 10 tons of standard armor, which gives it less armor protection than other designs of the time. Mobility is enhanced with five jump jets, and CASE mounted in its right torso protected against complete destruction from a magazine detonation. Additional equipment and weapons are allotted 16 tons of pod space, giving decent flexibility. The Avalanche gains its name from its primary configuration which consists of two LRM-10 launchers in its torso, which obscure it in a white, snow-like cloud of smoke when firing. These are backed up with a quartet of ER medium lasers mounted in the arms. Quirk: Well Balanced Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

content.original: The Avalanche is a thirty-second century medium OmniMech, first deployed by the Draconis Combine and Clan Nova Cat. After decades of development, the Avalanche would still have a number of design flaws which would give it a bad reputation among warriors of Clan Nova Cat. The 'Mech would soon be deployed shortly before House Kurita's invasion of the Republic of the Sphere, where it would serve among House Kurita's elite forces. After the destruction of Clan Nova Cat, as a result of its revolt against Coordinator Yori Kurita, the dead Clan's allotment of Avalanches would be sold off to other Inner Sphere powers.

content.original: The Avalanche is a thirty-second century medium OmniMech, first deployed by the Draconis Combine and Clan Nova Cat. After decades of development, the Avalanche would still have a number of design flaws which would give it a bad reputation among warriors of Clan Nova Cat. The 'Mech would soon be deployed shortly before House Kurita's invasion of the Republic of the Sphere, where it would serve among House Kurita's elite forces. After the destruction of Clan Nova Cat, as a result of its revolt against Coordinator Yori Kurita, the dead Clan's allotment of Avalanches would be sold off to other Inner Sphere powers.

content.original:
Developed in 3133 this Awesome variant is protected by thirteen tons of Stealth Armor and a Guardian ECM Suite. The weaponry has been replaced with a Light Gauss Rifle, LRM-15, Extended LRM-15, and a single ER medium laser. The ammunition and Gauss rifle are protected by CASE II systems. For emergency use, a single Coolant Pod can supplement the ten double strength heat sinks. A Compact Gyro freed enough room in the center torso to store three tons of ELRM ammunition. A 240 XL engine provides a top speed of 54 km/h, but this is supplemented by a Supercharger which allows for bursts of speed up to 64 km/h. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

content.original: Juggernaut & Defender
content.prevOriginal: Juggernaut & Defender
content.content: Juggernaut & Defender

content.original: The Awesome is traditionally used in a vanguard role when penetrating enemy defenses. The Awesome's massive firepower also lends it to defensive actions, acting as a mobile turret when necessary. Because of its reliance on PPCs, the Awesome is able to act independently for extended periods of time. This trait is also useful in siege situations where the 'Mech can keep up a constant barrage, allowing it to win battles of attrition through bleeding an enemy dry. The only downsides to the Awesome is its low maneuverability and lack of rear-facing weaponry, making it vulnerable to being outflanked and surrounded by lighter 'Mechs, although good intelligence and a well-deployed screening force can mitigate this issue.

content.original:
The newest variant, a joint project between IBMU and Alshain Weaponry, was introduced in 3067. The 'Mech utilizes Irian's Compact Engine and Compact Gyro to save space at the expense of mass. It retains the speed and ECM of the 9Q, but utilizes an Endo Steel structure. Two Heavy PPCs deal a good amount of damage in each blow, while a Snub-Nose PPC is deadly and accurate at close range. At the time of its introduction the 10KM was reserved for only the elite units of the Free Worlds League and Draconis Combine, and thanks to an iron-clad contract even the wily Irian Technologies had trouble finding a loophole to sell the 'Mech to the other Houses or mercenary units. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.2

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

content.original: The BJ-2 was introduced in 3052 by the Federated Suns as the new production model of the Blackjack, based on earlier experimental designs. It upgrades the 'Mech with two Diverse Optics Sunbeam ER Large Lasers in place of the autocannons and removes the medium lasers for four Hovertec Streak SRM-2 launchers, two each in the left and right sides of the torso. One ton of ammo for the launchers is kept in the left torso while the standard heat sinks were upgraded to double heat sinks.

content.content: Skirmisher

content.original: The Brahma was designed after the Taurian Concordat was invaded during the Jihad. During that time, the Taurian Defense Force took heavy losses when they put their older machines up against the cutting edge technologies available to the Federated Suns. Though the Taurians were successful in driving the AFFS out of Taurian space and inflicted notable losses on the Federated Suns, the cost to the Concordat in men and matériel was just too high. With that realization uppermost in their minds, the TDF commissioned a new BattleMech that would force the Taurian industrial community to upgrade their factories. If the factory wasn't able to build a component the designers wanted, the TDF reallocated funds to add that production capability to the factory. Thus the Brahma serves not only as a BattleMech for combat, but as a technology driver as well. Though the designers originally wanted a 55 ton 'Mech that would complement the Griffin, Shadow Hawk, and Wolverine, they were unable to fit all the technology in a medium 'Mech chassis. The Brahma therefore displaces sixty tons.
content.prevOriginal: The Brahma was designed after the Taurian Concordat was invaded during the Jihad. During that time, the Taurian Defense Force took heavy losses when they put their older machines up against the cutting edge technologies available to the Federated Suns. Though the Taurians were successful in driving the AFFS out of Taurian space and inflicted notable losses on the Federated Suns, the cost to the Concordat in men and matériel was just too high. With that realization uppermost in their minds, the TDF commissioned a new BattleMech that would force the Taurian industrial community to upgrade their factories. If the factory wasn't able to build a component the designers wanted, the TDF reallocated funds to add that production capability to the factory. Thus the Brahma serves not only as a BattleMech for combat, but as a technology driver as well. Though the designers originally wanted a 55 ton 'Mech that would complement the Griffin, Shadow Hawk, and Wolverine, they were unable to fit all the technology in a medium 'Mech chassis. The Brahma therefore displaces sixty tons.
content.content: The Brahma was designed after the Taurian Concordat was invaded during the Jihad. With that realization uppermost in their minds, the TDF commissioned a new BattleMech that would force the Taurian industrial community to upgrade their factories. If the factory wasn't able to build a component the designers wanted, the TDF reallocated funds to add that production capability to the factory. Thus the Brahma serves not only as a BattleMech for combat, but as a technology driver as well. Though the designers originally wanted a 55 ton 'Mech that would complement the Griffin, Shadow Hawk, and Wolverine, they were unable to fit all the technology in a medium 'Mech chassis. The Brahma therefore displaces sixty tons.

content.original: This variant of the Dasher II reduces the top speed of the 'Mech to 120 km/h. The weapons have also been removed and replaced by a single ER PPC, while the hand actuators have been replaced by claws for close-quarter combat. The weight freed up by the engine swap allows this variant to carry more than twice the armor of its progenitor design. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.08

content.original: The original Fire Moth, designated Dasher by the Inner Sphere, is a light 'Mech that is known for having great speed but weak armor, and it was found that the Dasher was not very effective at swarm tactics or raiding due to this deficiency. Because of this deficiency in the design the Dasher II entered service during the Word of Blake Jihad. Much heavier and sturdier than the original Dasher, the Dasher II has a top speed of 162 km/h that equals that of the original Dasher. The Dasher II's top speed allows it to close in to effectively use its firepower.

content.original: This variant is equipped for close combat. It carries a chain whip and Triple Strength Myomer, while an XL gyro and XXL engine free up space for more weaponry. The Dasher II 4 carries two LRM-5 launchers, an ER large laser, ER medium laser, and ER small laser, while a single micro pulse laser provides some anti-infantry support. The 'Mech's top speed is usually 100 km/h, but with the TSM active it can hit 110 km/h. Eight improved jump jets allow it to cover 240 meters per jump, and the Dasher II 4's armor protection is enhanced with the use of hardened armor. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.08

content.original:
The E configuration carries a Targeting Computer to control two ER Medium Lasers, two Large Pulse Lasers, an ER PPC, and ER Large Laser. Four Streak SRM-4s are also carried. The Deimos E can also reach speeds nearing 86 km/h by using an engine Supercharger and the MASC system. It retains the AMS as well. Finally it mounts a Radical Heat Sink System to augment the sixteen double heat sinks. Quirk: Anti-Air Targeting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

content.original: The Deimos was developed by the Snow Raven Clan and the Mech was first introduced during the middle of the 3060s, allegedly on the Kerensky Cluster world of Lum. However, Inner Sphere intelligence agencies stopped hearing rumors about the 'Mech during the Jihad and it faded from memory. In 3085, the Snow Ravens revealed the existence of the Deimos to the Inner Sphere. It is considered as the pride of the Clan making at least one assigned to every touman. The prime variant was designed for anti-air role and fire support.

The removal of the Guardian ECM suite and use of a downgraded 225-rated XL engine frees up enough weight to replace the snub-nose PPC with a captured large re-engineered laser. This variant, introduced in 3137, also mounts six tons of heat-dissipating armor to deal with hostile plasma and inferno weapons. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Medium Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.96

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

content.original: The Ebony is a light BattleMech produced jointly by the Magistracy of Canopus and the Capellan Confederation. This stealthy BattleMech first appeared in 3081, and was reportedly being built in factories on Canopus IV and Sian. The 'Mech is allegedly named for the Magistracy's secret intelligence branch, the Ebon Magistrate.

The T variant uses a mix of Inner Sphere and Clan weaponry. A Clan ER PPC is mounted in the right arm, opposite a Clan Ultra Autocannon/5 in the left. A Streak LRM-10 and an Improved Heavy Medium Laser are carried in the left torso with one ton of both LRM and Autocannon ammunition. The right torso mounts twin Thunderbolt 5 launchers and their two tons of ammunition. Both side torsos are equipped with CASE II. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

content.original: Once fielded in great numbers by the Smoke Jaguars, the Ebon Jaguar has proliferated to many of Kerensky's Clans, though some, like the Wolves, Jade Falcons and Coyotes, continue to field Hellbringers instead.

content.original: Created for the mercenary market, the 3P is geared towards short-range combat. The ER large lasers are swapped out for large pulse lasers, while its remaining missiles systems swapped out for three SRM-2 launchers, one found in each of the 'Mech's torsos. A single ER small laser mounted in the center torso rounds out the armaments. To allow the design to close quickly with its target, Triple Strength Myomer is added to the design, with weight being freed by the removal of two of the double heat sinks. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.03

content.original: The Exhumer is a medium BattleMech first produced for the Draconis Combine in the third decade of the thirty-second century. The 'Mech was first advocated to enter the Draconis Combine Mustered Soldiery by Benjamin District Warlord Mitsura Sakamoto, who felt that the design would become a mainstay of the Combine's Armed forces. With the Warlord's backing, the 'Mech would finally enter service with its first production models joining the 2nd Benjamin Regulars in 3129. However, early engagements using the 'Mech by frontline forces would prove disastrous due to a flaw in the Exhumer's targeting systems. The 'Mech orders from DCMS were subsequently canceled, shuffling the produced units to sale in the mercenary market.

content.original:
This Fennec 3133 variant uses an XXL engine and endo-composite skeleton to save weight. The standard C3 master computer has been replaced with a C3 boosted master computer, and it is armed with a large re-engineered laser and a Clan-spec ER medium laser in each arm. A Clan-built light active probe allows the 'Mech to identify hidden enemies, and heat management is handled by 11 double heat sinks tied into a Radical Heat Sink System. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.03

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

content.original: The Fennec is a medium BattleMech that was produced for the Federated Suns beginning in the early 3080s, conceived to help address the AFFS' need for lighter lance command 'Mechs. Corean Enterprises used components from the Legionnaire to help put the design into production at its plant on Augusta.

content.original: Designed for long-range combat, the Gambit was a solid, light BattleMech, the second 'Mech to have been brought to market by Adam Tech Industries. Straightforward to maintain and built around some of the most popular items on the market including armor plating, heat sinks, and myomer bundles, the Gambit was very popular with 'Mech technicians following its entry to service in 3136. Adding to the Gambit's appeal for MechWarriors was the cockpit, which in addition to featuring a reliable emergency release mechanism, was also armored to resist battle armor-scale weapons for at least 10 seconds - a feature clearly intended to make the Gambit suitable for use in the battlefields of the Dark Ages.

content.original: The Götterdämmerung is a Heavy class BattleMech first fielded by the Lyran Commonwealth in 3138, the 'Mech's German name translates to twilight of the gods or ragnarök. The Götterdämmerung's durability is due in part of layers of Heavy Ferro-Fibrous Armor, while Blackstone would move the cockpit of the 'Mech to the torso. The Torso-Mounted Cockpit's ejection system is highly complex, making escape from the Götterdämmerung difficult under certain circumstances. MechWarriors piloting the 'Mech need also be wary of losing their side torsos, due to the split placement of their life support systems.

content.original:
This Dark Age variant of the Hatamoto carries a Gauss rifle, twin MRM-20s enhanced with Apollo FCS, and a single ER medium laser. It uses a standard fusion engine to reach a top speed of 54 km/h. The Gauss Rifle has three tons of ammunition, and the two missile launchers also draw from a shared three ton ammo bay. The Hatamoto-suna also uses an XL Gyro to save some weight, and is protected by seventeen and a half tons of Reinforced Armor. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

Arm Actuator Limit: Left Lower

content.original: A melding of the popular Star League era Thug and the poorly regarded Charger, the samurai-themed Hatamoto-Chi was the first post–Succession Wars Draconis Combine BattleMech constructed utilizing recovered LosTech. Tasked by Kanrei Theodore Kurita to reverse engineer examples of the advanced Star League Defense Force BattleMechs provided by ComStar in 3035 for future production, Luthien Armor Works secretly mated the weaponry of the Thug to the form of the maligned Charger. While initially unable to mass produce the advanced Endo Steel chassis required to match the Thug, the appearance of the early Hatamoto-Chi and their endless variations born of the Charger's spacious torso sent the combined Armed Forces of the Federated Commonwealth into confusion during the War of 3039.

content.original:
Another post-Blackout variant, this 'Mech is a regimental or battalion commander's unit. It uses the same chassis, engine, and armor layout as the Hatamoto-suna. Its only armament is a pair of Clan-spec ER medium lasers and a single Extended LRM-15 with three tons of ammunition. To compensate, the Hatamoto-godai is equipped with a Guardian ECM Suite, Bloodhound Active Probe, two C3 boosted master computers, and a Command Console that has been armored. To defend against incoming missile fire, it has a Clan-built Laser Anti-Missile System in the right torso. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

Arm Actuator Limit: Left Lower

content.original: Designed to support Assault Mechs such as the Victor and the Emperor, the 60 ton Helios is a St. Ives Compact design that entered production in 3058. Powered by a 240-rated Fusion Core and built on an Endo Steel chassis, the Helios HEL-4A is armed with an ER PPC. A trio of Medium Lasers and an MRM-20 make for a potent combo should anyone try to close range.

content.original: The Hercules was built in response to a request by the Free Worlds League for a 'Mech with balanced mobility and firepower. The Hercules is powered by a 350 XL engine that propels the 'Mech up to speeds of 86.4 km/h. The Hercules is also well armored, with eleven tons of Heavy ferro-fibrous for protection. Overall, the Hercules has turned out to be a good all-around trooper 'Mech that can handle a variety of combat roles, from air defense to long-range direct fire support.

content.original:
The Jackalope JLP-BD's eight jump jets and 240-rated XL engine allow it to leap up to 240 meters and reach a top speed of 129 km/h, giving it the ability deploy rapidly and quickly get to wherever it needs to go on the battlefield. This speed gives it an additional degree of protection beyond its six and a half tons of ferro-fibrous armor and its Clean Sweep laser anti-missile system. Its key component is its Clan designed light active probe, making it a valuable scout while leaving enough room for additional equipment. The 'Mech's principal weaponry includes two Clan-tech ER medium lasers, which are located in its stubby but flexible arms. Additionally, an ATM-6 launcher mounted in the right torso provides the Jackalope added punch at all ranges. However the design only has room for one ton of ammunition, cutting down its endurance in longer campaigns and reducing the pilot to reliance on the lasers. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

content.original: Produced jointly by Victory Conditions Industries and Eris Enterprises, the Jackalope represented a leap forward in anti-missile and recon technology. Designed to serve in recon and pursuit lances, this compact and swift BattleMech was used to full effect in combat, and additionally served as a training 'Mech and as an arena combat 'Mech. The 'Mech gets its name from a mythical animal which was said to have existed on Terra's North American continent.

content.original:
A mixed tech version of the standard Jackalope, the C is designed to serve as lancemate for a C3 lance. Fitted with an Inner Sphere-produced C3 slave unit, this variant becomes an excellent spotter for its lance. The design drops the ATM-6 for a Clan produced SRM-6 supplied with two tons of ammunition. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

content.original:
This variant, also known as the 'Wolpertinger' is a mixed tech version of the Jackalope's KA variant. Built with the mostly Clan technology, the 'Mech retains the KA's fragile but powerful XXL fusion engine and also gains additional jump capacity with the inclusion of a partial wing and eight improved jump jets. While retaining the KA's Clan ER medium lasers in the arms, a standard SRM-4 is added to the right torso, with its ammo in the left torso with CASE II protection. The only Inner Sphere technology found in the machine is its XL gyro. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

content.original: Originally developed by the defunct Marik-Stewart Commonwealth to produce a local Assault BattleMech, the Juliano would go on to serve in the ranks of the newly re-formed Free Worlds League. Produced on Angell II at Irian's Mech production facilities during the mid thirty-second century, this Assault BattleMech was named after the league's first Captain-General, Juliano Marik.

Produced on Angell II at Irian's Mech production facilities during the mid thirty-second century, this Assault BattleMech was named after the league's first Captain-General, Juliano Marik.

content.original: The King Crab-000b, the Star League's Royal variant, is every bit as powerful as its downgraded cousin, the -0000. Still armed with twin AC/20s, the -000b's double heat sinks and doubled ammo keeps the massive cannons firing far longer and more frequently making the -000b a true terror on the battlefield.

content.original: The Kodiak II was built upon what Clan Ghost Bear learned and liked with the original Kodiak. The Kodiak II quickly became known for its Command facilities and its endurance. The powerful 'Mech carries 19 tons of Standard armor, giving it heavy resistance against weapons fire directed at it. At the heart of the machine is a 400-rated Extra-Light Fusion Engine, which while not as quick as other designs its weight saving qualities allows the 'Mech to carry is substantial weapons load out.

content.original: Intended as a symbol of Inner Sphere/Clan unity, the Kuma (Japanese for "Bear") is a fast if lightly armed Ghost Bear Dominion heavy cavalry BattleMech. While derisively referred to by some as the Charger IIC, the specialist Kuma was a heavy cornerstone to light Stars in the post-Jihad Dominion touman. Built on an Endo Steel frame, powered by an enormous 360 XL fusion engine and equipped with a large number of Improved Jump Jets, the Kuma is one of the most mobile heavy 'Mechs ever built, with a ground speed equal to the medium-weight Phoenix Hawk and a jump distance as high as the light-weight Spider. Clad in ten and half tons of standard armor, eleven Double Heat Sinks are barely able to cope with the design's weaponry and jump jets.

content.original:
Constructed using Inner Sphere technologies, the 'Mech design was envisioned with economics in mind. The Avalanche is powered by a 250-rated fusion engine, giving it a modest maximum speed of 86 km/h, while its hull is protected by 10 tons of standard armor, which gives it less armor protection than other designs of the time. Mobility is enhanced with five jump jets, and CASE mounted in its right torso protected against complete destruction from a magazine detonation. Additional equipment and weapons are allotted 16 tons of pod space, giving decent flexibility. The Avalanche gains its name from its primary configuration which consists of two LRM-10 launchers in its torso, which obscure it in a white, snow-like cloud of smoke when firing. These are backed up with a quartet of ER medium lasers mounted in the arms. Quirk: Well Balanced Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

content.original:
Developed in 3133 this Awesome variant is protected by thirteen tons of Stealth Armor and a Guardian ECM Suite. The weaponry has been replaced with a Light Gauss Rifle, LRM-15, Extended LRM-15, and a single ER medium laser. The ammunition and Gauss rifle are protected by CASE II systems. For emergency use, a single Coolant Pod can supplement the ten double strength heat sinks. A Compact Gyro freed enough room in the center torso to store three tons of ELRM ammunition. A 240 XL engine provides a top speed of 54 km/h, but this is supplemented by a Supercharger which allows for bursts of speed up to 64 km/h. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

content.original:
The newest variant, a joint project between IBMU and Alshain Weaponry, was introduced in 3067. The 'Mech utilizes Irian's Compact Engine and Compact Gyro to save space at the expense of mass. It retains the speed and ECM of the 9Q, but utilizes an Endo Steel structure. Two Heavy PPCs deal a good amount of damage in each blow, while a Snub-Nose PPC is deadly and accurate at close range. At the time of its introduction the 10KM was reserved for only the elite units of the Free Worlds League and Draconis Combine, and thanks to an iron-clad contract even the wily Irian Technologies had trouble finding a loophole to sell the 'Mech to the other Houses or mercenary units. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.2

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

content.original: This variant of the Dasher II reduces the top speed of the 'Mech to 120 km/h. The weapons have also been removed and replaced by a single ER PPC, while the hand actuators have been replaced by claws for close-quarter combat. The weight freed up by the engine swap allows this variant to carry more than twice the armor of its progenitor design. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.08

content.original: This variant is equipped for close combat. It carries a chain whip and Triple Strength Myomer, while an XL gyro and XXL engine free up space for more weaponry. The Dasher II 4 carries two LRM-5 launchers, an ER large laser, ER medium laser, and ER small laser, while a single micro pulse laser provides some anti-infantry support. The 'Mech's top speed is usually 100 km/h, but with the TSM active it can hit 110 km/h. Eight improved jump jets allow it to cover 240 meters per jump, and the Dasher II 4's armor protection is enhanced with the use of hardened armor. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.08

content.original: Created for the mercenary market, the 3P is geared towards short-range combat. The ER large lasers are swapped out for large pulse lasers, while its remaining missiles systems swapped out for three SRM-2 launchers, one found in each of the 'Mech's torsos. A single ER small laser mounted in the center torso rounds out the armaments. To allow the design to close quickly with its target, Triple Strength Myomer is added to the design, with weight being freed by the removal of two of the double heat sinks. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.03

This Fennec 3133 variant uses an XXL engine and endo-composite skeleton to save weight. The standard C3 master computer has been replaced with a C3 boosted master computer, and it is armed with a large re-engineered laser and a Clan-spec ER medium laser in each arm. A Clan-built light active probe allows the 'Mech to identify hidden enemies, and heat management is handled by 11 double heat sinks tied into a Radical Heat Sink System. This Dark Age variant of the Hatamoto carries a Gauss rifle, twin MRM-20s enhanced with Apollo FCS, and a single ER medium laser. It uses a standard fusion engine to reach a top speed of 54 km/h. The Gauss Rifle has three tons of ammunition, and the two missile launchers also draw from a shared three ton ammo bay. The Hatamoto-suna also uses an XL Gyro to save some weight, and is protected by seventeen and a half tons of Reinforced Armor. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

content.original:
The Jackalope JLP-BD's eight jump jets and 240-rated XL engine allow it to leap up to 240 meters and reach a top speed of 129 km/h, giving it the ability deploy rapidly and quickly get to wherever it needs to go on the battlefield. This speed gives it an additional degree of protection beyond its six and a half tons of ferro-fibrous armor and its Clean Sweep laser anti-missile system. Its key component is its Clan designed light active probe, making it a valuable scout while leaving enough room for additional equipment. The 'Mech's principal weaponry includes two Clan-tech ER medium lasers, which are located in its stubby but flexible arms. Additionally, an ATM-6 launcher mounted in the right torso provides the Jackalope added punch at all ranges. However the design only has room for one ton of ammunition, cutting down its endurance in longer campaigns and reducing the pilot to reliance on the lasers. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

content.original: Developed by Majesty M&M from battle data gathered in engagements with the Word of Blake's patterns of Phoenix Hawk BattleMechs, the Agrotera is a fast, hard-hitting Medium 'Mech packed with some of the most cutting-edge technology available. An XL 300 fusion engine and 240-meter jump capacity give the Agrotera excellent agility for it's weight class, while 9.5 tons of armor keep it reasonably safe against the hits that do land. The Agrotera is no slouch giving hits back, sporting an ERPPC linked to an advanced Actuator Enhancement System, backed by a Medium VSPL. A single normal Medium Pulse Laser and a pair of Small Pulse Lasers round out the Agrotera's arsenal and leave it well equipped to handle virtually any battlefield threat, entirely independent from supply line restrictions.

content.original: Built by Luthien Armor Works of New Samarkand, the Hitotsume Kozo is a medium BattleMech designed to serve in the Draconis Combine Mustered Soldiery. This 'Mech's creation was partially influenced by an unofficial cultural rebirth. Keeping this in mind, LAW styled the appearance of the Hitotsume Kozo after the ancient Japanese Bushido armor worn by the samurai warriors during that time period on Terra. It received a poor reception by front-line troops due its advanced features and high heat output; however, it was appreciated when transferred to less-favored combat units, such as Ghost Regiments, as these less-fickle warriors adapted to the design's quirks and turned it into an effective combat unit.

This 'Mech's creation was partially influenced by an unofficial cultural rebirth. Keeping this in mind, LAW styled the appearance of the Hitotsume Kozo after the ancient Japanese Bushido armor worn by the samurai warriors during that time period on Terra. It received a poor reception by front-line troops due its advanced features and high heat output; however, it was appreciated when transferred to less-favored combat units, such as Ghost Regiments, as these less-fickle warriors adapted to the design's quirks and turned it into an effective combat unit.
content.content: Built by Luthien Armor Works of New Samarkand, the Hitotsume Kozo is a medium BattleMech designed to serve in the Draconis Combine Mustered Soldiery. This 'Mech's creation was partially influenced by an unofficial cultural rebirth. Keeping this in mind, LAW styled the appearance of the Hitotsume Kozo after the ancient Japanese Bushido armor worn by the samurai warriors during that time period on Terra. It received a poor reception by front-line troops due its advanced features and high heat output; however, it was appreciated when transferred to less-favored combat units, such as Ghost Regiments, as these less-fickle warriors adapted to the design's quirks and turned it into an effective combat unit.

content.original: The personal 'Mech of Raul Ortega moves the RAC/5 from its torso mount to the right arm, giving it a wider field of fire. It also exchanges the targeting computer for three medium lasers. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Medium Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.03

content.original: The Legionnaire was developed as the Federated Suns answer to the Lyran Blitzkrieg, and entered production during the Word of Blake Jihad. A lance of Legionnaires played an important role in the Third Battle of New Avalon, where they quickly assaulted the Blakist force's left flank as they were attempting to ford the Thames river, breaking their momentum and eventually forcing them off world. Capable of reaching 118 km/h, the Legionnaire is a fast flanker.

content.original: Debuted in 3145 on The Pool Arena and piloted by Judith Benson. Fitted with the latest in Clan-made HarJel armor-repairing technology around the torso sections virtually ensures that its opponent will not land an engine-killing hull breach any time soon. Clan-spec weaponry is mounted, with two ER large lasers and two ER medium lasers giving the Ariel better than-average reach both above and below the water line. Finally, The TAG unit was removed. Quirk: Nimble Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

content.original: Debuted in 3139 on the King of the Mountain Arena and piloted by Ming-Na Salonga, this variant replaces its hatchet for a large vibroblade made to resemble a katana. The original hardened armor is replaced with conventional standard armor, making the 'Mech faster and more agile. Otherwise, the Mulan keeps to the original design. Quirk: Stable Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.06

content.original: A prototype in 3146 whose production was delayed due only to lack of parts, the AXM-5N was rapidly built for the desperate AFFS after the Davion recapture of New Syrtis from the Capellans. Using a number of components shared with the Hatchetman 7D and Caesar 5D, the AXM-5N carries a Tiburon Khanate–supplied HAG 20 in its right torso, supported by a left arm–mounted Sea Fox Clan ER PPC and a trio of IS-grade ER medium lasers in the right arm, and fitted with a Guardian ECM suite. Though carrying three tons of HAG reloads, the AXM-5N primarily relies on its energy weaponry to activate its triple strength myomer to enhance both its speed and the damage inflicted with its hatchet. Quirk: Melee Actuators Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

content.original: The Furillo manufactured 3S introduced in 3057 removes the XL Engine of the 1N and 2N variants and replaces it with a Light Fusion Engine. This exclusively Lyran variant of the Axman is armed with a massive LB-X Autocannon/20, which allows it to fire either solid rounds or cluster rounds that act like a 'Mech sized shotgun. The 'Mech also carries three ER Medium Lasers for close combat and a Guardian ECM Suite, which defends against enemy electronic warfare equipment.
